0.title: Priyanka Chopra shares pic of 'Made in India' manhole cover in Los Angeles
0.article_body: Priyanka Chopra shared a picture on Instagram of herself and her niece Krishna alongside a 'Made in India' manhole cover they spotted in Los Angeles. 'Made in India' manhole covers began to crop up in US in late 1980s and 1990s, a report in The Juggernaut said. These covers are exported to US after being made in foundries in India.

1.title: Richa Chadha posts pics, says 'Healthy weight loss means you don't lose muscle'
1.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha posted pictures on Instagram along with the caption, "Healthy weight loss means you don't lose muscle, like in my case the gluteus maximus is intact." Chadha, who lost 15 kg in 3 months, took to Instagram in February this year and shared a video about embracing our "ever-changing bodies".

2.title: Delhi Police arrests MBA student who posed as woman on Insta to cheat people
2.article_body: A 25-year-old MBA student has been arrested by Delhi Police for allegedly cheating people using a fake Instagram account on which he posed as a woman and sold fake cryptocurrency and investment schemes. E-vouchers worth ₹15 lakh were found with the accused. He was arrested from Haryana after a woman alleged she was cheated of over ₹1.7 lakh by him.

3.title: The day when Manish Pandey will be dropped is not far: Aakash Chopra
3.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said LSG batter Manish Pandey, who has scored 22 runs in three games this season, might be dropped from the playing XI unless he starts contributing with the bat. "Someone will have to go once Marcus Stoinis comes. I feel Manish Pandey's days are really numbered if he continues batting like this," stated Aakash.

4.title: Class 10 girl in Ludhiana dies by suicide fearing poor grades
4.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide a day after appearing for her Class 10 pre-board examination in Ludhiana. The girl, who aspired to become a doctor, felt she performed poorly in the exam, her family told the police. Reportedly, she was also upset over scoring less in a school test as her exams were due.

5.title: Terror attacks aimed at crippling Kashmir's economy: JKPC chief
5.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference chief Sajad Lone on Tuesday said that the recent terror attacks were aimed at crippling the economy. "The violence in Kashmir is not only senseless and barbaric but also aimed at economically crippling the Kashmiri economy," said Lone. "The butchers seem to be hell-bent on destroying [the economy]," he added.

6.title: India's maritime sector scaled new heights in last 8 years: PM Modi
6.article_body: On the occasion of National Maritime Day, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that in the last eight years, India’s maritime sector has scaled new heights and contributed to boosting trade and commercial activities. "Today, on National Maritime Day we recall our glorious maritime history and highlight the importance of the maritime sector towards India’s economic growth," PM Modi tweeted.

7.title: World has found resonance, volcano has erupted: Ashoke on 'The Kashmir...'
7.article_body: Filmmaker and social activist Ashoke Pandit, while talking about 'The Kashmir Files', said that not only India but the world has found resonance in the thought process of the film. "[The world] wants to know why no one spoke about this issue earlier. A volcano has erupted and there is no stopping now," he added.

8.title: CSK can't lose 3 in a row even if Deepak Chahar's missing: Irfan Pathan
8.article_body: Reacting to CSK recording their worst start in an IPL season after losing their first three IPL 2022 matches, Irfan Pathan tweeted that CSK need to step up. He added that CSK can't lose three consecutive matches despite missing Deepak Chahar. CSK lost by 54 runs in their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. Chahar is recovering from a hamstring injury.

9.title: Why not ban liquor in Ramzan?: Cong leader on banning meat sale during Navratri
9.article_body: Reacting to reports of meat shops asked to shut in some parts of the country for Navratri, Congress leader Salman Nizami said, "Why not ban liquor during Holy Ramadan?" Taking to Twitter, the politician said, "If you don't eat onion or meat in Navratri why stop others. Is this democracy? What about our sentiments and constitutional rights!"

10.title: He would travel 80 km for practice: MI all-rounder Tilak Varma's coach Bayash
10.article_body: MI all-rounder Tilak Varma's coach Salam Bayash said Tilak would travel 80 km for practice, adding that the cricketer's family members were very supportive despite facing hardships. Tilak scored 61 runs off 33 balls at a strike rate of 184.84 in MI's IPL 2022 match against RR, with the knock comprising three boundaries and five sixes.

11.title: SRH had upper hand till Avesh's over, he has improved in last 12 months: Shastri
11.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has praised LSG pacer Avesh Khan for his performance against SRH, stating that the 25-year-old has improved in the last 12 months. "SRH had the upper hand [till Avesh's over]...He's improving. I've seen him come up through the ranks...Last year's IPL gave him a lot of confidence," stated Shastri. Avesh picked four wickets against SRH.

12.title: Alia Bhatt-backed D2C wellness startup Phool raises $8 million
12.article_body: Alia Bhatt-backed fragrance-focussed wellness startup ﻿Phool.co has raised $8 million in Series A funding led by Sixth Sense Ventures. The round also saw participation from existing investors, actress Alia Bhatt and IAN fund. Founded by Ankit Agarwal, Phool.co focuses on converting floral waste into charcoal free luxury incense products. Alia had invested in the startup in October.

13.title: 3 tigers die in 3 days in Madhya Pradesh forests over territorial fights
13.article_body: Three tigers were found dead in two forests of Madhya Pradesh in the past three days, forest officials said, adding that the cause of deaths was territorial fights. One of the dead tigers was aged five months. "The carcass has grievous injury marks. The spinal cord was found broken, as though she was attacked by another tiger," an official said.

14.title: SP MLA Shazil Ansari booked for objectionable remarks against UP CM
14.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA, Shazil Islam Ansari from Bhojipura, and others were booked for making objectionable remarks against UP CM Yogi Adityanath in Bareilly, police said. Ansari had also allegedly said, "If the voice of the opposition is suppressed...then a reply will be given through guns." FIR was lodged following a complaint by Bareilly's Hindu Yuva Vahini district president.

15.title: Squid Game maker to helm Killing Old People Club, says 'It'll be more violent'
15.article_body: Hwang Dong-hyuk, director of South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', has announced that he's developing 'Killing Old People Club', a film inspired by a novel penned by Italian historian-novelist Umberto Eco. He said it will be more violent than 'Squid Game', adding that he might have to hide from old people after the film comes out.

16.title: Group with AK-47s shoots at Bihar MLC candidate's convoy; 1 dead
16.article_body: An Independent candidate for Bihar MLC elections had a narrow escape after a group of assailants armed with AK-47s allegedly shot at his convoy in Siwan on Monday. A 30-year-old villager who was in a car behind the convoy was killed in the attack after multiple bullets hit him. Four people, including two of the poll candidate's supporters, were injured.

17.title: We need to overhaul our legal structure in a big way: IT Minister
17.article_body: India needs a legal structure that balances the right to freedom of expression and regulation of cyberspace, IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. "We need to overhaul our legal structure in a big way. I don’t think any incremental changes will help," he added. "The change has to be substantial, structural and fundamental and that's where the conflict starts," Vaishnaw stated.

18.title: Peru imposes curfew to curb protests over rising fuel costs
18.article_body: Peruvian President Pedro Castillo on Tuesday imposed a curfew in the capital Lima, banning people from leaving their homes to curb protests against rising fuel and fertiliser prices, triggered by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Peruvian government said the protests that have spread throughout the country have become increasingly violent and at least four people have been killed so far.

19.title: It's my passion project, we shot it in one go: Abhishek on 'Oththa...' remake
19.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan in an interview spoke about his upcoming project, tentatively titled 'SSS7', which is the Hindi remake of Tamil thriller film 'Oththa Seruppu Size 7'. The actor, who's also producing the film, said, "It's my passion project. We shot it in one go." "I'm the only actor in...film. Although there are other characters, you never see them," Abhishek added.

20.title: Dad never raised his hand on me but mom tried to smack me a few times: Abhishek
20.article_body: When asked if his parents, actor Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bachchan ever reprimanded him when he was a student, Abhishek Bachchan replied, "They never scolded me...they'd calmly explain to me that they were working very hard to pay for my education...My father...never raised his hand on me." He said that his mother had "tried" to smack him a few times.

21.title: Planet 9 times bigger than Jupiter found forming unconventionally
21.article_body: NASA's Hubble telescope has spotted a gigantic Jupiter-like planet forming in an "unconventional way". The discovery supports a long-debated theory for how planets like Jupiter form, called "disk instability", NASA said. Sharing the images taken by Hubble, NASA said the planet, called AB Aurigae b, is probably about nine times bigger than Jupiter.

22.title: US rapper's dead body seen standing upright as funeral held at nightclub
22.article_body: The dead body of rapper Goonew, who was shot dead during a robbery on March 18, was seen standing upright at a nightclub in US. The funeral of the 24-year-old rapper, whose real name was Markelle Antonio Morrow, was held at the nightclub, with video showing people dancing. An entry pass for the event called it a "celebration of life".

23.title: 3 dot balls should be 1 wicket: Chahal on Chopra's '8 runs for 100-plus metre six' remark
23.article_body: While reacting to PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone's 108-metre six against CSK, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra suggested that eight runs should be given for 100-plus metre six. Reacting to Chopra's tweet, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal tweeted, "Three dot balls should be one wicket bhaiya." Commenting on Chahal's tweet, Suresh Raina wrote, "Hahah."

24.title: It was my duty: Rajasthan policeman who saved infant from burning house tells CM
24.article_body: Netresh Sharma, a 31-year-old constable whose photo of saving an infant from a burning house amidst violence in Rajasthan's Karauli went viral, told CM Ashok Gehlot that he was performing his duty on a phone call with him. Gehlot promoted Sharma to the post of Head Constable and congratulated him. Sharma saved four lives during communal violence in the city.

25.title: Woman rubs chilli powder in son's eyes in Telangana for marijuana addiction, video viral
25.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a woman rubbing chilli powder in her son's eyes after tying him to pole as a punishment for marijuana addiction. The video is from Kodad town in Suryapet district of Telangana. In the video, the 15-year-old boy was heard screaming after he was tied to the pole.

26.title: Man booked for molesting brother's wife in Ludhiana
26.article_body: Ludhiana Police booked a man for allegedly molesting his 26-year-old sister-in-law on Sunday. The complainant alleged her husband's brother molested her after a spat on March 8. He had also attempted to establish a physical relationship with her on multiple occasions, she claimed. The woman also alleged that she informed her husband about the incident, but to no avail.

27.title: Our media should boycott them: Kangana on Lata's name missing at Grammys, Oscars
27.article_body: Kangana Ranaut expressed her disappointment after Grammy Awards and Academy Awards omitted Lata Mangeshkar in the 'In Memoriam' section during their ceremonies. "We must take strong stands against any local awards who claim to be international and yet ignore...legendary artists because of their race or ideologies," she wrote on Instagram. She added "our media should...boycott these biased events".

28.title: Delhi court acquits man in death of minor 'electrocuted by water cooler'
28.article_body: A Delhi court has acquitted a man who was accused in the death case of his neighbour's five-year-old son. The minor was allegedly electrocuted by a water cooler owned by the man in May 2004 in southwest Delhi. The victim's father had claimed that the cooler had a leakage and despite several warnings, the accused did not fix it.

29.title: Fraudster cheats senior citizen of ₹85,000 in Mumbai, police recover money
29.article_body: The cyber unit of the Mira Bhayandar-Vasai Virar (MBVV) police recovered ₹85,000 that a Mumbai-based senior citizen had lost in a cyber-fraud. The fraudster, impersonated as an SBI executive, stole her banking details and shopped on Flipkart. The cyber unit checked the transactions and got in touch with Flipkart's nodal officer and made them reverse the transactions, saving her money.

30.title: You set me on the path of environmental consciousness: Grammy winner to PM Modi
30.article_body: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Ricky Kej for winning the second Grammy Award, the Indian music composer tweeted, "Wow.. speechless! To receive praise from the Hon'ble Prime Minister himself!" "I hope I made you proud. You set me on the path of environmental consciousness 7 years ago when I won my 1st Grammy award," he said.

31.title: 45-yr-old truck driver from B'luru arrested for running over stray dog in Mumbai
31.article_body: A 45-year-old truck driver from Bengaluru has been arrested and his vehicle has been seized for allegedly running over a stray dog in Mumbai's Andheri (West), police said. The incident was witnessed by a local resident, who alerted police. The accused was produced before a magistrate court and was granted bail on the surety of ₹40,000, police added.

32.title: 10 held in last two days for fleeing with poultry trucks in Pune
32.article_body: The Pune rural police have arrested 10 people so far in the last two days in connection with two separate incidents of armed robbers capturing trucks carrying chickens. In the first case, the suspects ran chicken shops prior to the pandemic but had run into losses while in the second one, the suspects desired to earn easy money, police said.

33.title: 2 house helps booked as Mumbai woman complains of theft, sexual harassment
33.article_body: Police have registered an FIR and have booked two house helps after a 45-year-old woman in Mumbai complained of theft and sexual harassment. The victim said one of the accused allegedly stole ₹19,000 from her house last month, following which he stopped coming to work. As per the FIR, the other accused had allegedly sent her obscene video and messages.

34.title: Shared carnatic music with friends, they'd say 'it's weird': Musician Aditya
34.article_body: Carnatic Musician Aditya Prakash said that he and his "desi friends" felt like outsiders and wanted to fit in an "American social setting". "I was embarrassed to share Carnatic music with my friends. The few times I did, they would say 'this is weird, what is this'. There was a wall built between my identities," he added.

35.title: Congress does not look outside the Gandhi family: Anurag Thakur
35.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised the Congress and said that the party does not look outside the Gandhi family. "Rahul Gandhi took charge but didn't get any seats in West Bengal. Priyanka Gandhi took charge of UP but lost deposits and won only two seats. Now again Sonia Gandhi has taken command of the party," he added.

36.title: 3 teenage boys on picnic drown in river in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni
36.article_body: Three 16-year-old boys in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district drowned while bathing in a river on Monday. According to police, the incident occurred at 4 pm at the Hirri river near Jenwara village when the boys had gone for a picnic with another friend. They entered the water when their friend had gone to bring breakfast, police added.

37.title: 2 minor girls killed as fire breaks out in slums of Indore
37.article_body: Two minor girls aged six and four were allegedly killed after a fire broke out at a slum in Indore on Monday. The fire which started in a slum that belonged to Sonu Medha reportedly spread to other parts. After initial inquiry police said, the fire was a result of deliberate arson following a dispute between Sonu and his family.

38.title: Not a huge fan of Du Plessis, I don't see anything special in his captaincy: Akhtar
38.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said he's not a huge fan of RCB captain Faf du Plessis and would like to see if the 37-year-old can revive the franchise's fortunes. "At times, Plessis doesn't look that sharp during his leadership. He has been given the responsibility of leading a huge franchise...I'm not sure how far Faf will go," stated Akhtar.

39.title: Fire breaks out in Navi Mumbai, no casualties reported
39.article_body: A fire broke out in the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC) area in Mahape, Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. As per initial reports, a diesel pipeline leak is believed to be the reason behind the fire occurrence. However, no casualties have been reported so far. An official from the Vashi fire station said that the "fire has been brought under control".

40.title: Dad constantly reinvented himself, I've secretly imbibed his passion: Ranbir
40.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that his late father and actor Rishi Kapoor constantly reinvented himself. "I have secretly imbibed from him his passion and his belief that it's all about the process and not the result," Ranbir said, adding that Rishi believed that every actor has to find his own way and that you have to learn from your mistakes.

41.title: HC stays trial court summons to Subramanian Swamy in defamation case
41.article_body: Delhi HC stayed the summons and other proceedings issued by Rouse Avenue Court against Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy in a defamation case. Delhi BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga alleged that Swamy had posted a defamatory tweet against him. Swamy had tweeted, "Journalists from Delhi told me...before joining BJP, Bagga was jailed several times...for petty offences."

42.title: I think Mohammed Siraj will be excellent against Jos Buttler: Hogg
42.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj will be excellent against RR's right-handed batter Jos Buttler in their match in IPL on Tuesday night. "Siraj is getting the ball to come back into the right-handers and he likes to attack that middle and leg-stump line," stated Hogg. Buttler scored 100(68) in RR's last game against MI.

43.title: What are the causes?: Traffic police on video of accident in Hyd
43.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Monday shared a video of a non-fatal bike accident in Hyderabad's Raidurgam and questioned what are the accident's causes. The police also listed three mistakes of the car driver including not maintaining safe distance, not following lane discipline and wrong overtaking. The video purportedly shows the car hitting the bike while overtaking another car.

44.title: Kashmiri Pandit shopkeeper injured as terrorists fire upon him in J&K
44.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit shopkeeper, Bal Krishnan, received critical gunshot injuries on hands and legs after he was fired upon by terrorists near his house in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir.  Krishnan, who was injured in the fourth terrorist attack in the valley in 24 hours, was taken to the Army hospital in Srinagar.

45.title: My son is mentally unstable: Father of IIT grad who attacked 2 policemen in UP
45.article_body: A day after an IIT graduate was arrested for attacking two policemen outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh, the accused's father claimed that his son was not mentally stable. "Since childhood, he has suffered from depression...He believed that police were after him," his father said, adding that he had no intention to commit the crime.

46.title: Japan flies 20 Ukrainian refugees into Tokyo by special flight
46.article_body: The Japanese government flew a special flight to bring 20 Ukrainian refugees to Tokyo on Tuesday. The refugees, including 15 women, were reportedly aged between six to 66 years. "The government of Japan is committed to provide the maximum support to these 20 Ukrainians to help them live with a sense of peace in Japan," said Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi.

47.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist held in joint operation in J&K's Sopore
47.article_body: A Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist was arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Sopore, police said on Monday. The terrorist was arrested in a joint operation by the Indian Army and J&K Police from Ladoora area of Rafiabad. "The apprehension of LeT terrorist averted a major incident in North Kashmir. He was assigned to plan attack on security forces personnel," the police added.

48.title: Nobody negotiated with Hitler: Polish PM to Macron over talks with Putin
48.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki criticised French President Emmanuel Macron for holding talks with Russian leader Vladimir Putin over Ukraine. "Mr. President Macron, how many times have you negotiated with Putin, what have you achieved? Have you stopped any of the actions that have taken place? One should not negotiate with criminals, one should fight them...Nobody negotiated with Hitler," he said.

49.title: CRED announces first few winners of CRED bounty
49.article_body: CRED announced that with CRED bounty, members can buzz friends and win big this IPL season. Deepak Gupta won Apple package, including iPhone, MacBook, AirPods, and more, CRED revealed, adding that Amit Ghosh won Greece cruise trip and Diwanshu Gaur, Azhar Saifi and Sachin Sharma won Tanishq jewellery worth ₹2 lakh, Amazon vouchers worth ₹2 lakh, and Sony package respectively.

50.title: Virat Kohli said younger members of team felt intimidated by Anil Kumble: Vinod Rai in book
50.article_body: Ex-CoA chairman Vinod Rai, in his book, said that Virat Kohli mentioned to him that young members of Team India felt intimidated by the way Anil Kumble worked with them when he was the head coach. "It was conveyed that Kumble was too much of a disciplinarian and hence the team members were not too happy with him," he wrote.

51.title: Jaaved Jaaferi to return as Hindi commentator for Takeshi's Castle 2: Report
51.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi will reportedly return as a Hindi commentator for Takeshi Kitano-hosted Japanese game show 'Takeshi's Castle 2'. Sharing a post about the show that mentioned 'the best part was the Hindi commentary by Jaaved Jaaferi', he tweeted, "Hmm! What do you think?#TakeshisCastle #OnceMore". Taking to the comments section, one user commented, "Will only watch if you're [commentating]!"

52.title: Ensure no further illegal construction around Jama Masjid: HC to NDMC
52.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday directed the North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) and Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to ensure that no further illegal construction takes place around Jama Masjid. A PIL was filed which argued that no construction or reconstruction is to be permitted around the ancient monuments in the area but authorities failed to act against the violations.

53.title: Price of lemons increases to ₹10 each in April in Pune: Report
53.article_body: The price of lemons has increased to ₹10 each from the previous ₹2 each in January and ₹5 each in March in the retail market, the Hindustan Times reported. The report said that the price rise is due to heat waves. "Rate of lemon in the wholesale market is between ₹2,000 and ₹2,500 for...300-500 lemons," a traders' association's president said.

54.title: Missing 15-year-old girl found killed in hit-and-run case in Delhi
54.article_body: A day after a girl (15) went missing, she was found killed in a hit-and-run accident in Delhi's Mayapuri, police said. The girl was heading to her aunt's house when a speeding car hit her, after which onlookers rushed her to the hospital where she was declared dead, police said. However, the deceased's family has alleged laxity by the police.

55.title: UK MP Imran Khan sexually assaulted man in his sleep in Pakistan, court told
55.article_body: UK MP Imran Ahmad Khan sexually assaulted a man in his sleep after smoking marijuana and drinking whisky, a court has heard. The man alleged that Khan sexually assaulted him at a guest house in Pakistan in 2010. The Conservative MP is on trial at Southwark Crown Court for sexually assaulting a 15-year-old boy at a house in January 2008.

56.title: Musk is sending strong signal to Twitter CEO Agrawal: Cathie Wood
56.article_body: ARK Invest's Cathie Wood said that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "sending a strong signal" to the new Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, after Musk's 9.2% Twitter stake was revealed. She added Musk is making a statement about censorship and that Musk doesn't believe in it. Wood also discussed that the news could also be "setting up for another leadership change".

57.title: Elderly Sikh man assaulted in New York; Indian consulate condemns
57.article_body: An elderly Sikh man, Nirmal Singh, was reportedly assaulted in US' New York. Images of the victim with a bloodied turban, face and clothes surfaced on social media. Calling it "deeply disturbing", the Consulate General of India in New York condemned the incident and said they were in touch with the police investigating the incident.

58.title: Decline in dropout rates among schoolgirls in 3 yrs: Govt
58.article_body: Dropout rates among schoolgirls declined to 1.2% at the primary level in 2019-20, Union Minister Annapurna Devi told Parliament. At the secondary level, the dropout rates fell from 18.4% in 2017-18 to 17% in 2018-19 and then to 15.1% in 2019-20. Devi said Bihar accounted for the highest dropout rate in three years at the upper-primary level.

59.title: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing at Nagpur airport, smoke seen coming out of aircraft
59.article_body: A Lucknow-bound flight had to make an emergency landing at the origin after take-off from Nagpur due to a suspected technical snag, the airline said on Monday. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation ordered an inquiry into the incident after smoke was seen coming out of the aircraft, said a senior DGCA official.

60.title: I hope KGF 2 also works: Shahid on Jersey's clash with KGF 2
60.article_body: Shahid Kapoor's upcoming sports-drama 'Jersey' is set to clash with Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' on April 14. The actor, during a promotional event for 'Jersey', opened up about his film being the underdog in comparison with 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "I feel...the scale doesn't matter. If a movie is good I think it'll work...I hope KGF 2 also works," Shahid said.

61.title: MP govt to introduce digital locker system in all colleges, universities
61.article_body: In a move to provide marksheets, certificates, migration, and other documents to students digitally, the Madhya Pradesh government is set to introduce a digital locker system in all of the state's colleges and universities. The documents will be made available to students through this system phase-wise, an official informed. In the first phase, marksheets will be made available, he added.

62.title: Licence to meat shops only if they agree to not operate during Navratri: South Delhi Mayor
62.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor Mukkesh Suryaan has said that from now onwards licences for running meat shops will be issued to traders only if they agree not to operate during the Navratri. Suryaan has also written to CM Arvind Kejriwal to withdraw discounts on alcohol during Navratri and, if possible, stop the sale of liquor for those nine days.

63.title: 32-yr-old drowns in a lake at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park
63.article_body: A 32-year-old man died after drowning in a lake at Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) in Mumbai's Borivali on Monday, police said. "The deceased, Uday Pinker, had gone for a picnic with his four companions and allegedly jumped into the river after having lunch and liquor," they added. His body was taken out after three hours of search, police said.

64.title: Rajamouli dances to 'Naatu Naatu' at 'RRR' success party, video surfaces
64.article_body: A video of director SS Rajamouli dancing to the song 'Naatu Naatu' at the success party of 'RRR' has surfaced online. The party was hosted by producers Dil Raju and Shirish on Monday, and it was also attended by actors Ram Charan and Jr NTR. The film also featured Alia Bhatt, Ajay Devgn and Shriya Saran in the key roles.

65.title: I'd tell Pooran to just play his game, if you feel like smacking it, do it: Shastri
65.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said SRH wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran should "just play his game" and not worry about what the team expects. "Because if he starts thinking too much...that's when such players at times lose their rhythm," explained Shastri. Pooran has scored 0 and 34 in SRH's two games so far in the ongoing IPL season.

66.title: 'Pawry' gone 'Awry': UP police on people partying on car roof video
66.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has shared a video on Instagram of people partying on a car's roof with the heading- "A car-roof-top 'Pawry', gone 'Awry'". The police also captioned the post, saying that a "complimentary treat" is on them if they find people partying on the "wrong rooftop". "Please send...invitation to 112 and Uttar Pradesh Police too," the police added.

67.title: SRK, Akshay unsuccessful; wonderful to be generation's successful host: Kangana
67.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories to say that actors Shah Rukh Khan, Ranveer Singh, Akshay Kumar and actress Priyanka Chopra are "unsuccessful hosts". "Only Shri Amitabh Bachchan ji, Salman Khan ji...and Kangana Ranaut have achieved...this glory to be super star host," she said, adding that she feels wonderful to be the only successful host of her generation.

68.title: 97 swords, 2 kukris seized from courier parcels in Pune
68.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Police seized 92 swords, 2 kukris and 9 scabbards worth ₹3.7 lakh from a consignment en route to Aurangabad at a courier firm's office in Pune's Dighi. They also seized five more swords worth ₹15,000 from another consignment being sent to Ahmednagar. The vigilance officer, who spotted the weapons while scanning parcels, had immediately informed the police.

69.title: 2 women held in Chandigarh in connection with dowry death case
69.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested two women in connection with around a two-year-old dowry death case in which a newly married woman died by suicide at her house in Ramdarbar. The victim’s husband was arrested earlier. The two women include the victim’s mother-in-law and sister-in-law. "An FIR was lodged on the statement of the victim’s father in 2019," a police officer said.

70.title: AIADMK worker, 4 others surrender over DMK worker's murder in TN
70.article_body: Five people, including an AIADMK worker, on Monday surrendered before a court in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpet after a DMK worker was killed at a bus stand in broad daylight in Chennai a day before. The accused AIADMK worker and the deceased were reportedly fighting over a spot at the bus stop where the latter had put up a water stall.

71.title: France to expel "many" Russian diplomats; Moscow vows response
71.article_body: France on Monday said that the country has decided to expel "many" Russian diplomats, "whose activities are contrary to our security interests". "This action is part of a European movement," the French Foreign Ministry said amid the war between Russia and Ukraine. Moscow will respond to France's move, Interfax news agency reported, citing the Russian Foreign Ministry.

72.title: Two execs leave Trump's Truth Social after troubled app launch: Report
72.article_body: Two senior executives of former US President Donald Trump's social media venture Truth Social have resigned from their posts, Reuters reported. Josh Adams and Billy Boozer's exit follows the venture's troubled launch of an iPhone app in February. Both the executives had joined the venture last year.  The exit of two executives could imperil the company's progress, sources said.

73.title: 4-lane steel bridge inaugurated at Silent Valley in Hyderabad
73.article_body: A four-lane steel bridge at Silent Valley in Hyderabad was inaugurated by Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday. Built at a cost of ₹30.30 crore, the bridge is expected to reduce the distance between Jubilee Hills and Shaikpet from around 5 km to 3.5 km. The minister also inaugurated other infrastructure projects in the city on Monday.

74.title: 250 leaders and workers from AAP, Cong join BJP in Gujarat's Vadodara
74.article_body: Around 250 leaders and workers from AAP and Congress in Gujarat's Vadodara joined BJP on Monday. AAP leader Satish Makwana and Congress leader Jayshree Gohil were among those who joined BJP, an official release by the party stated. They joined BJP "considering the public service done by the party under PM Modi's leadership", BJP's state General Secretary Pradipsinh Vaghela said.

75.title: 1 dead, 39 injured as HRTC bus crashes into wall in Himachal; CM visits hospital
75.article_body: The driver of a Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus was killed and 39 passengers were injured when the vehicle, on its way from Manali to Shimla, rammed into a retaining wall in Mandi district. Initial reports claim the driver lost control while negotiating a sharp curve. Chief Minister Jairam Thakur visited the injured persons at the zonal hospital.

76.title: Qawwali singer who made provocative remarks in MP arrested from Kanpur
76.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police arrested qawwali singer Sharif Parvaz, who was booked for making provocative comments against the country, PM Narendra Modi, Amit Shah and Yogi Adityanath from Kanpur. The qawwali singer was brought to Rewa after the arrest, the police said. He made the alleged controversial remarks while performing at a musical event in Rewa on March 28.

77.title: I am not 'anti-Indian': Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan
77.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has said, "I am not against any country. I am not anti-Indian or anti-American...I want friendship with them and there should be respect." Khan added he was against countries that disrespect other sovereign countries. Earlier, Khan, who was de-notified as PM of Pakistan, proposed the name of former Chief Justice Gulzar Ahmed as caretaker PM.

78.title: Constable harasses woman professor for wearing bindi in B'desh; held
78.article_body: A police constable in Bangladesh has been arrested for harassing and threatening to kill a woman professor of a private college for wearing a bindi, police said. Reportedly, the policeman had hurled abuses at Professor Lata Samaddar after seeing a bindi on her forehead and when the teacher protested, the policeman tried to run her over with his motorbike.

79.title: Mark Waugh made Test debut by replacing dropped twin Steve Waugh
79.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Mark Waugh made his Test debut in Ashes in 1991, replacing his elder twin brother Steve Waugh who was dropped over poor form. Mark later revealed when Steve had announced the news to the family, he found it "a bit awkward". Steve and Mark became the first twins to appear together in a Test on April 5, 1991.

80.title: Elon Musk starts poll on edit button, Twitter CEO Parag says 'Please vote carefully'
80.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a Twitter poll asking users if they want the microblogging platform to have an edit button. Responding to the poll, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal said, "The consequences of this poll will be important. Please vote carefully." Earlier, Musk asked users if they believed Twitter rigorously adhered to the principle of free speech.

81.title: It is now or never if we want to limit global warming to 1.5°C: UN
81.article_body: Jim Skea, Co-Chair of IPCC Working Group III, which released UN's latest report on climate change, said, "It's now or never...if we want to limit global warming to 1.5°C." He added, "Without immediate and deep emissions reductions across all sectors...it'll be impossible." "We are on...pathway to global warming of more than double the 1.5°C limit," UN chief António Guterres said.

82.title: Biden’s granddaughter Naomi to hold wedding reception at White House
82.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will host their granddaughter Naomi's wedding reception at the White House. Naomi, 28, will marry 24-year-old Peter Neal, who is studying law at the University of Pennsylvania. "Peter and I are endlessly grateful to my Nana and Pop for the opportunity to celebrate our wedding at the White House," tweeted Naomi.

83.title: They are within you: Anushka as Mallika remembers her late parents' love story
83.article_body: Comedian Mallika Dua narrated her late parents, Vinod Dua and Dr. Padmavati Dua's love story. In the video, she said, "[My parents] got married and lived together happily ever after with a brief six-month gap between their respective journeys to heaven." Sharing Mallika's video on her Instagram Story, Anushka Sharma wrote, "They are within you. This is so beautiful Mallika."

84.title: Govt having discussion, should announce booster dose policy soon: Adar Poonawalla
84.article_body: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has said, "We have appealed to the government (for a policy on booster dose of COVID-19 vaccines) as everyone who needs to travel needs to take the booster dose." He added, "They're having an internal discussion and should announce very soon in next few days on the booster policy."

85.title: Comical: HC after jail denies book to Elgar Parishad accused Navlakha
85.article_body: After the Taloja jail authorities denied giving Elgar Parishad accused Gautam Navlakha a PG Wodehouse book sent by his family, the Bombay High Court termed it "comical". "Is this true? Wodehouse is considered a security threat? This is really comical," HC said. Adding that this shows the attitude of jail authorities, HC stated, "At least basic needs should be met."

86.title: Our responsibility is to keep the country united: Maha minister
86.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut on Monday, while reacting to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's comment to remove the loudspeakers from mosques, said, "It is our responsibility to keep the country united." "India is a country of different languages, religions and cultures...It is really sad that people are giving such statements about religion, it shows their mentality," the minister added.

87.title: Did we have loudspeakers during inception of religion? : BJP's Roopa Ganguly
87.article_body: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray opposed to the use of loudspeakers at mosques, BJP's Roopa Ganguly said a religion's campaign shouldn't make others "insane". "I don't understand, did we have the concept of a loudspeaker during the inception of religion? What's the point of it?" Ganguly added. "This process of playing loudspeakers 5-10 times a day shouldn't continue," Ganguly stated.

88.title: 2 held for trying to steal bullet train material in Navsari
88.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly trying to steal bullet train construction material worth ₹14.85 lakh in Navsari on Monday. According to police, the accused, who were travelling in a car and tempo, loaded construction material onto them and tried to escape. When the security guard stopped the tempo, they abandoned their vehicles and fled the spot, police added.

89.title: I'm not pregnant, leave me alone: Hailey on pregnancy rumours after Grammys
89.article_body: American model Hailey Bieber has shut down pregnancy rumours after making an appearance at the Grammys 2022. Reacting to one of the reports claiming that she was expecting her first child with singer Justin Bieber, Hailey wrote, "I'm not pregnant, leave me alone". The model was hospitalised last month after suffering 'stroke-like symptoms'.

90.title: Plan was to hit yorker length: Avesh on missing hat-trick vs SRH
90.article_body: LSG pacer Avesh Khan has revealed that his plan was to bowl a yorker to dismiss Romario Shepherd, who survived his hat-trick ball in the 18th over in their match against SRH. On his performance, Avesh added, "It's been a great environment...[management] has been encouraging me to keep bowling as per my rhythm." Avesh picked four wickets in the game.

91.title: US approves potential sale of F-16 jets to Bulgaria amid Ukraine war
91.article_body: Amid the Ukraine war, US State Department has approved the potential sale of eight F-16 aircraft and related equipment to Bulgaria for $1.67 billion. "The proposed sale will improve Bulgaria's capability to meet current and future threats by enabling the Bulgarian Air Force to deploy modern fighter aircraft routinely in the Black Sea region," US Defense Security Cooperation Agency said.

92.title: Ukraine Prez to address UNSC over mass killings in Bucha
92.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will address the UN Security Council on Tuesday over the mass killings reported in Bucha town. "These are war crimes and it will be recognised by the world as genocide," Zelenskyy had said after visiting the town. Pictures of bodies scattered on streets surfaced triggering strong reactions from world leaders, including US President Joe Biden.

93.title: Meta briefly blocked hashtags related to Bucha killings in Ukraine
93.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta briefly blocked hashtags related to civilian deaths in Ukraine's Bucha. "This happened automatically because of the graphic content people posted using these hashtags," Meta spokesman Andy Stone said. He added that the firm unblocked the hashtags after it was made aware of the issue. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for an independent probe into the killings.

94.title: Punjab shopkeeper ties up, beats 6-yr-old boy on suspicion of theft
94.article_body: A case was filed on Monday after a shopkeeper in Punjab's Ludhiana allegedly tied up and beat a six-year-old boy with an iron rod on the suspicion that he stole a dress. The boy's mother claimed that her son told her he'd taken the dress to the shopkeeper after seeing it on the floor. The incident took place last month.

95.title: Gujarat dentist gets life term for killing her brother, his daughter
95.article_body: A sessions court in Gujarat’s Patan sentenced a dentist to life imprisonment until death for murdering her brother and his 14-month-old daughter with “datura” (thornapples) and potassium cyanide in 2019. The verdict pronounced noted that the accused committed the murder with “preplanning” where she slow poisoned her brother with datura in glucose water for six to eight months.

96.title: India reports 795 new COVID-19 cases, 58 deaths in last 24 hours
96.article_body: India has reported 795 new COVID-19 cases and 58 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 58 deaths reported today, 56 were reconciled deaths in Kerala, while one death each was recorded in Delhi and Karnataka. This comes a day after the country saw 913 cases and 13 deaths.

97.title: Nursing body issues notice on book allegedly listing 'dowry merits'
97.article_body: Indian Nursing Council (INC) on Monday issued a statement over the alleged listing of "Merits of Dowry" in the Sociology for Nurses textbook, saying that it "strongly condemns any derogatory content" which is against the law. It also clarified that it only prescribes syllabus on its website. "Ugly looking girls can be married off with...attractive dowry," the book read.

98.title: No fine to be imposed for not wearing face masks in Chandigarh
98.article_body: Amid the declining number of COVID-19 cases, the Chandigarh Administration on Monday issued an order stating that no fine will be imposed for not wearing face masks in public places and workplaces. "However, the general public is advised to adhere to COVID-19 appropriate behaviour including wearing of face masks, hand hygiene and maintaining social distancing," the order reads.

99.title: It's not in India’s interest to increase Russian energy imports: US
99.article_body: The United States believes that it's not in India's interest to increase Russian energy imports and other commodities, said White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Monday. She, however, noted that India's imports of Russian energy represent only 1-2% of its total energy imports. She added that the US would be happy to be a partner in reducing India's reliance.

100.title: Samantha to be replaced from film with estranged husband Naga Chaitanya: Report
100.article_body: Samantha Prabhu will reportedly be replaced from a film that also starred her estranged husband Naga Chaitanya. Reports added, the former couple isn't interested in sharing screen together.  Previously, they were supposed to collaborate with director Nandini Reddy for a project, however, Nandini reportedly decided to stick with Naga and is now searching for an actress who can replace Samantha.

101.title: Amid loudspeaker row, Maha Home Minister Walse halts speech during Azaan
101.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil stopped his speech during Azaan. The incident took place in Maharashtra's Shirur. While halting his speech, Walse reportedly gestured his followers to wait till Azaan was over. Meanwhile, MNS chief Raj Thackeray had earlier threatened to play 'Hanuman Chalisa' in front of mosques if loudspeakers in mosques were not silenced.

102.title: ₹2,000-5,000 fine for 1st drinking offence in Bihar, 1-yr jail if caught for 2nd time
102.article_body: The Bihar government has announced that a fine between ₹2,000 and ₹5,000 will be imposed on those who are caught drinking alcohol for the first time in the state. If first-time offenders fail to pay the fine, they can be imprisoned for a month. Those caught drinking for second time can be imprisoned for one year, if charges are proved.

103.title: Varun Dhawan congratulates WWE star Triple H on retiring, shares throwback pic with him
103.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram to congratulate WWE star Triple H on retiring from in-ring action. Varun shared an old video of their interaction and a throwback picture. He wrote, "One of my all-time favourite WWE superstars hung up his boots at WrestleMania...I was fortunate enough to meet him...talk to him about my love of pro-wrestling and The Rock."

104.title: I know where India's economy is: Ramiz clarifies 'We'll see who goes to play IPL' remark
104.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja has clarified his remark wherein he had suggested that cricketers would prefer PSL over IPL once he takes PSL to the auction model and puts its purse in the IPL bracket. "I was misquoted...I know where the economy of India is and where is Pakistan's...We have plans to improve the PSL," Ramiz said.

105.title: Pune school denies entry to students over fee issue, allows later
105.article_body: Several students were denied entry and their parents were allegedly manhandled by the bouncers of the Euro School in Undri, Pune. They were readmitted after the intervention of the education department and police. According to Audumbar Ukirde, deputy director of education (Pune), the issue escalated after 61 students were given transfer certificates (TCs) for not paying last year's fee.

106.title: Bengaluru reports 36 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
106.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 36 new cases of COVID-19 and one related death, according to official data by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike. With 34 recoveries, the active cases in the city now stand at 1,399. Further, 8,471 people were vaccinated in the city on Monday. According to data, the positivity rate now stands at 0.93%.

107.title: Chandigarh issue should be resolved by sitting together: Haryana CM
107.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Monday said that the Chandigarh issue should be resolved by "sitting together". "It’s not something that can be passed unilaterally in the Assembly," Khattar added. "They (AAP) have not been in power for four days and are raising these controversial issues, there must be a hidden agenda behind this," Khattar stated.

108.title: Curfew extended in Rajasthan's Karauli till April 7 after communal clashes
108.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC imposed in Rajasthan's Karauli, where communal clashes broke out, has been extended till April 7 in view of the law and order situation. Officials said class 10 and 12 students can reach their exam centres after showing their admit cards. A two-hour relaxation will be given to allow people to make essential purchases, officials added.

109.title: Alia to shoot for her H'wood debut in May after wedding with Ranbir: Report
109.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who is set to make her Hollywood debut with director Tom Harper's 'Heart of Stone', will begin shooting for the project in May, after tying the knot with Ranbir Kapoor this month, according to a report. "Post her wedding in mid-April, she will be flying to the United States Of America for her film's shoot," the report said.

110.title: Russia revising war aims, will focus on eastern Ukraine: US
110.article_body: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said that "Russia is revising its war aims" and repositioning its forces to capture "eastern and parts of southern Ukraine, rather than target most of the territory". "Russia will seek to surround and overwhelm Ukrainian forces in eastern Ukraine" and then "it could...use any tactical success it achieves to...mask...prior military failure", he added.

111.title: Himachal records birth of 1st female calf using sexed semen technique
111.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has recorded the first female calf birth using the sexed semen (gender selected) technique. The calf has been named 'Ambika'. The birth has been reported by Chaudhary Sarwan Kumar Himachal Pradesh Agriculture University (HPAU), Palampur. HPAU vice-chancellor said that the experiment using the technique has been successful as a Sahiwal breed cow has delivered a healthy female calf.

112.title: PM Modi congratulates Indian-American singer Falguni Shah for winning Grammy
112.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday congratulated Indian-American singer Falguni Shah on winning the award for the Best Children's Music Album at the Grammys. "Wishing her the very best for her future endeavours," PM Modi tweeted. "I have no words to describe today's magic," Shah had said after winning the award.

113.title: It was close but not close enough: Williamson on defeat vs LSG
113.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said the match against LSG, which they lost by 12 runs, was close but not close enough. "If you look at [our] performance, [it] was certainly much improved from our first outing...[chasing] 170 on any day is a challenge...Didn't quite work [against LSG]," he added. SRH have now lost their first two games of the season.

114.title: Gurugram vends slash liquor rates after Delhi govt allows discount: Report
114.article_body: The liquor retailers in Gurugram are reportedly slashing their rates and offering a slew of offers after the Delhi government's decision to allow discounts up to 25% on liquor bottles in the national capital. Retailers in Gurugram told HT that they have no option but to cut prices, as sellers in Delhi sold cheaper bottles using catalogues and pamphlets.

115.title: Restaurants in Bengaluru to get costlier by 10%: Hotel association
115.article_body: Restaurants in Bengaluru could get costlier owing to rise in prices of edible oils, cooking gas, fuel and other materials, said Bruhath Bangalore Hotels Association. "The prices of food items at restaurants and eateries will increase by around 10% next week, " said PC Rao, President of the association. "Building rents and staff salaries have also gone up," he added.

116.title: Labourer gets 10 year jail term for beating wife to death in Hyd
116.article_body: A labourer was sentenced to 10 years of jail on the charges of beating his 20-year-old wife to death with a bamboo stick in Hyderabad's Balapur in 2016, Rachakonda Police said on Monday. The couple had quarrelled after the deceased asked the accused, who had drunk toddy, for money for daily needs, police added. The accused was also fined ₹1,000.

117.title: 5 arrested with 2.6 kg opium, 1.5 kg cannabis in Ludhiana
117.article_body: Special branch of Ludhiana Police arrested five people for drug peddling in two separate incidents on Sunday. In the first case, police recovered 2.6 kg of opium from the bag of four people crossing the Quality Chowk area in auto and arrested them. In another case, a resident of Kanganwal was nabbed after police recovered 1.5 kg cannabis from him.

118.title: Attack on policemen at Gorakhpur's Gorakhnath temple a terror act: UP govt
118.article_body: The attack on policemen at Gorakhpur's Gorakhnath temple by a 29-year-old man is a part of a "deep conspiracy" and based on the available facts, it can be said that it was a terror act, Uttar Pradesh Home Department said. "He had tried to enter the temple premises with bad intention," the government added. The attacker is an IIT-Bombay graduate.

119.title: We end up back to square one, heroine is either bechari or b***h: Ananya
119.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday said that even though artists and performers feel they are doing something different, they could still be putting women in a box. "Even if an actor is playing...role of bad*ss, she might be a 'one- tone' bad***. So we end up back to square one...the heroine is either just a bechari, or just a bit**," she added.

120.title: DDA gives ₹130 cr to DMRC to speed up work on new metro line in Narela
120.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) has given ₹130 crore to Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to speed up construction work on the new metro line coming up in Delhi's Narela area. Over 25,000 flats are reportedly coming up in this area which currently faces issues related to connectivity. The DMRC has planned a 23-km-long Metrolite corridor between Rithala and Narela.

121.title: We've been brilliant with the ball, need to carry this forward: Rahul after win
121.article_body: Speaking at the post-match conference after defending their 169-run total against SRH, LSG captain KL Rahul said they've been "brilliant" with the ball in all three games so far and it's something they need to carry forward. Rahul, however, expressed concern about losing early wickets, stating that they need to play risk-free cricket.  LSG's Avesh picked four wickets against SRH.

122.title: Musk takes poll for Twitter edit button, CEO asks to vote carefully
122.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has posted a Twitter poll asking users if they want an edit button. Replying to the poll, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal tweeted that the consequences of the poll will be important. "Please vote carefully," he added. Earlier, Musk became the largest shareholder of Twitter after he disclosed that he owns a 9.2% passive stake in it.

123.title: Documents, office keys stolen from govt officer's car in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar
123.article_body: A central government official's car glass was broken and important documents, including department stamps and office and house keys, were stolen in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar area, police said. The victim, an Assistant Commissioner in the Union Animal Husbandry Ministry, said he had parked his car in the area and went in search of a mechanic after his car stopped.

124.title: I would scan my brain if I wake up as Cristiano Ronaldo: Virat Kohli
124.article_body: Virat Kohli has said that Cristiano Ronaldo is his favourite athlete of all time. On being asked about the first thing he'd do if he woke up as Ronaldo, Kohli said, "I'll do a scan of my brain and see where all that mental strength comes from." Earlier, Kohli had said Ronaldo is the most complete player he has seen.

125.title: Will use nuclear weapons if South Korea launch pre-emptive strike: Kim Jong Un's sister
125.article_body: North Korea will use nuclear weapons to "eliminate" South Korea's army if they launch a pre-emptive strike, Kim Jong Un's sister Kim Yo Jong said. This comes after South Korea's defence chief said their military had missiles with "the ability to accurately and quickly hit any target in North Korea when there are clear signs of North's missile launch".

126.title: 17-year-old boy killed, friend injured in bike accident in Pune
126.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was killed and his 23-year-old friend was grievously injured in a bike accident in Pune's Wanawadi. Eyewitnesses said that the bike, which the teen was driving without a licence, had crashed into an electric pole at high speed. The duo had not been wearing helmets when the accident took place around 1 am on Sunday.

127.title: Woman jumps into canal to die by suicide in Pune, policemen rescue her
127.article_body: Two Pune Police constables, who were on patrol duty, rescued a 26-year-old woman after she jumped into a canal in Sinhagad Road area in an attempt to die by suicide. "Primary probe suggests...woman's husband is alcoholic...she had been facing domestic issues," police said. "On Monday...after an argument between the two, she came to the canal...jumped into the water," police added.

128.title: Dial 112 if any policeman checks mobile phone: B’luru Commissioner
128.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Monday said that policemen are prohibited from "checking mobile phones of any citizen under any pretext". He asked the citizens to call 112 or 080-22942215 if any such incident takes place. "Your identity will remain confidential. You may also DM the time and location, we will do the further needful," he added.

129.title: Singer B Praak, wife Meera Bachan expecting their 2nd child, share pic of baby bump
129.article_body: Singer B Praak and his wife Meera Bachan took to Instagram to announce that they are expecting their second child together. Sharing a picture of Meera's baby bump, B Praak wrote, "Nine months preparing to fall In love for a lifetime." The couple's first son, Adabb Bachan, was born in July 2020.

130.title: Baby boy found abandoned near hospital in Hyderabad
130.article_body: A baby boy was found abandoned near Niloufer Hospital in Hyderabad, police informed on Monday. "It is believed that the baby was physically handicapped, the parents must have left the baby near the hospital, we are verifying the case," Nampally Inspector, Khaleel Pasha informed. The baby's condition was declared healthy by the officials.

131.title: 13-year-old boy kidnaps, kills 8-year-old friend in Delhi: Police
131.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was apprehended for allegedly kidnapping his eight-year-old friend and beating him to death with a stone in West Delhi, police said. The two got into a fight a few days ago and the teenager "wanted revenge", police added. The 13-year-old told police that he wanted to use the victim's phone and got angered when the latter refused.

132.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 13th time in 15 days
132.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for 13th time in 15 days. Petrol in Delhi will now cost ₹104.61 per litre as against ₹103.81 previously, while diesel rates have gone up from ₹95.07 per litre to ₹95.87, according to a price notification of state fuel retailers. In Mumbai, petrol now costs ₹119.67/litre, while diesel costs ₹103.92 per litre.

133.title: Mumbai school bus carrying students goes missing, traced after few hours
133.article_body: Parents of students from Lilavatibai Podar High School in Mumbai's Santacruz reached the campus on Monday afternoon when their children didn't reach home even after the bus carrying around 20 students left the school premises at 12:30 pm. When the students returned after a few hours, police clarified that the bus staffers were new and not aware of the routes.

134.title: Mumbai man hears drug talk between eatery owner, youth; police respond
134.article_body: A Twitter user said he overheard conversation about narcotics between restaurant owner and youth. “I went to...food outlet...Cheezeria in Mulund...was surprised to see...owner/manager sitting...was involved in supplying drug to...young guy...they were having conversation which I overheard (maal accha hai),” he tweeted. Mumbai Police responded by saying they have informed concerned police station.

135.title: Girl out to buy book loses way, Mumbai Police reunite her with family
135.article_body: Mumbai Police took to Twitter to share they reunited a girl, who had lost her way back home, with her family. "Nirbhaya Squad of Pant Nagar PS found a girl by the roadside, was crying. She went to purchase a book...she lost her way back home...That girl is reunited with her family by Pant Nagar Police Station," the tweet read.

136.title: Will take 'game-time decision': Woods on competing in 2022 Masters
136.article_body: US golfer Tiger Woods has said that he will take a "game-time decision" on participating in this week's 2022 Masters Tournament. "I will be heading up to Augusta today to continue my preparation and practice. It will be a game-time decision on whether I compete," Woods tweeted. Notably, Woods last competed in a major golf tournament in 2020.

137.title: LSG's ₹10-crore buy Avesh Khan takes 4 wickets as SRH lose 2 matches in a row
137.article_body: LSG pacer Avesh Khan, who was bought for ₹10 crore in the mega auction, took four wickets as LSG defeated SRH by 12 runs in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. SRH have now lost two straight matches, while LSG registered their second win in a row. LSG put up a total of 169/7 and restricted SRH to 157/9.

138.title: UP Police stations, collectorates corruption dens under BJP: Akhilesh
138.article_body: Terming BJP's zero-tolerance policy a "sham", Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said that police stations, tehsil offices and collectorates have become dens of corruption under the current UP government. He added, "Under the protection of power, the administration is engaged in oppressing the innocent and the poor, and bulldozers are being run on farmers."

139.title: Man caught with ₹15 lakh gold hidden under wig at Lucknow airport
139.article_body: A passenger, who allegedly tried to smuggle gold by hiding it under his wig, was arrested by the customs department at Lucknow Airport on Monday. According to officials, around 291 grams of gold worth over ₹15 lakh was seized from the man who arrived from UAE's Sharjah. The gold, in paste form, was concealed in a pouch under his wig.

140.title: CRPF personnel martyred, 1 injured in militant attack in J&K: Police
140.article_body: A CRPF personnel was martyred while another was injured in a militant attack in Maisuma area of J&K's Srinagar on Monday, police said. The injured personnel has been taken to hospital and a search operation is underway, police added. "Unreservedly condemn the cowardly attack...Our condolences go out to his family and friends," the National Conference party tweeted following the incident.

141.title: J'khand man kills girlfriend for refusing to return gifted smartphone
141.article_body: A 20-year-old man allegedly killed his girlfriend in Jharkhand’s Pakur after an argument over a smartphone he gifted her. The victim's body was found at a secluded spot on Monday, police said. The accused, who has been arrested, said he slit her throat with a sharp object as she refused to return phone and kept fighting over it, police added.

142.title: IndiGo suspends few pilots, they reportedly planned protest over pay cuts
142.article_body: Some IndiGo pilots were suspended for planning a mass leave on Tuesday to protest against pay cuts, reports said. IndiGo pilots' salaries were cut by as much as 30% during the COVID-19 pandemic's peak. "We confirm that a handful of IndiGo pilots have been suspended...for indulging in activities that are in contravention to the terms of their employment," IndiGo said.

143.title: 1 dead, 3 injured as car gets crushed between two trucks in Odisha
143.article_body: A car was crushed between two trucks after a dump truck hit it from behind on NH-16 in Bhubaneswar's Palasuni area. As per reports, the car's driver died on the spot while three others sustained injuries. The dump truck also hit another car and a motorcycle before ramming into the car. The truck's driver fled the spot after the accident.

144.title: Doda 1st to achieve 100% first dose vaccination for 12-14 yrs in J&K
144.article_body: J&K's Doda, which has around 55% of schools in inaccessible areas, has become the first district in the Union Territory to complete the administration of the first dose of Covid-19 vaccine among 100% of its 12-14 year age group, officials said on Monday. The way "our teams carried out...vaccination drive while climbing hills every day is commendable," an official added.

145.title: Amazon, Future Retail agree in Supreme Court to appear before SIAC
145.article_body: Amazon and Future Retail (FRL) expressed their agreement before the Supreme Court on Monday to appear before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) over FRL's deal with Reliance Retail. Amazon and FRL are involved in legal fight over FRL's ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance. The Supreme Court told the companies that it will request the arbitration tribunal to expedite the proceedings.

146.title: US can't independently confirm atrocities in Ukraine: Official
146.article_body: A senior US defence official on Monday said that the Pentagon is not in a position to independently confirm Ukrainian accounts of atrocities by Russian forces against civilians in the town of Bucha. "But we're also not in any position to refute those claims," he added. Russia has denied allegations of an alleged massacre in Bucha.

147.title: Nortje returns to training ahead of DC vs LSG, DC share pic
147.article_body: Ahead of DC-LSG clash in IPL 2022, DC posted a picture of pacer Anrich Nortje on Twitter practising in nets on Monday and wrote, "Nortje. Training. That's it. That's the post." Nortje hasn't played since T20I World Cup 2021 due to hip and back injuries. He has to get clearance from Cricket South Africa before making it to playing XI.

148.title: I'm very much alive: Rijiju after NCP leader Sule's slip of tongue
148.article_body: After NCP leader Supriya Sule, in a slip of tongue, said Kiren Rijiju was no more, the Union Minister tweeted, "I am very much alive." While appreciating Rijiju's role as the Sports Minister, Sule said he is no more, which she immediately corrected by saying he is no more the minister. Rijiju had also tweeted a clip of the incident.

149.title: Who were the top corporate donors to national parties in 2019-20 as per ADR?
149.article_body: Prudent Electoral Trust was the top donor to two national parties - BJP and INC - in FY 2019-20, according to a report by NGO ADR on Monday. The Trust donated 38 times in a single year to the two parties each, amounting to a total of ₹247.75 crore. Janakalyan Electoral Trust was the second-largest corporate donor, followed by ITC.

150.title: I cried for 40 minutes: World no. 1 Iga Swiatek on Ash Barty's retirement
150.article_body: Iga Swiatek, who became the world number one women's tennis player on Monday, revealed she cried for 40 minutes after she came to know that Ash Barty retired aged 25. "I didn't know it was going to happen...I always had this vision...we'd all play until we're 35 or something until our bodies are...tired that we can't anymore," she added.

151.title: Investors get ₹4.5 lakh crore richer as Sensex rallies over HDFC merger
151.article_body: Investors turned richer by over ₹4.5 lakh crore on Monday as Sensex ended 1,335 points higher at 60,612, primarily led by the merger announcement of HDFC and HDFC Bank. Data showed that investor wealth, measured by the combined market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, rose to around ₹272.46 lakh crore. Investors of HDFC group companies gained over 1 lakh crore.

152.title: BJP received highest corporate donations of ₹720 crore in 2019-20: ADR
152.article_body: BJP received the maximum corporate donations of ₹720.407 crore from 2,025 corporate donors in 2019-20, according to a report released by NGO Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). The BJP was followed by INC which received a total contribution of ₹133.04 crore from 154 corporate donors, and NCP with ₹57.086 crore in corporate donations. CPM received ₹6.9165 crore in corporate donations.

153.title: I've never traded stocks, I don't even have a brokerage account: Zoho CEO
153.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu told Moneycontrol, "I have never actually traded. In fact, I don't even have a brokerage account." Stockbroking startup Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath, who was also a part of the conversation, was asked if he would make a pitch to add Vembu on Zerodha. "I don't think Sridhar has to invest in the markets," Kamath replied.

154.title: This is last time we saw him walk out of NZ team: Guptill on Ross' farewell
154.article_body: Speaking about his teammate Ross Taylor, who retired from the game on Monday, New Zealand opener Martin Guptill said, "This is it; this [against the Netherlands] is the last time we saw him walk out of...New Zealand team." He added, "It'll be even more emotional when we wake up tomorrow morning and Ross is no longer going to be there."

155.title: Russian oligarch's yacht worth $90 million seized by US in Spain
155.article_body: A yacht owned by a Russian oligarch, Viktor Vekselberg, with close ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin has been seized by US authorities in Spain's Mallorca on Monday. The Tango is believed to be worth approximately $90 million, according to US' Department of Justice. The action is a part of US' response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

156.title: We played a lot of loose shots: Haque on Bangladesh's Durban Test loss
156.article_body: Bangladesh skipper Mominul Haque said his side played loose shots in their second innings after they lost first Test against South Africa by 220 runs on Day 5 at Kingsmead, Durban. "Unfortunately, we lost three wickets last night, that was crucial...we also know that Durban spins from the third-fourth day, we didn't capitalise well with the bat," he added.

157.title: AAP hasn’t been in power for 4 days, raising Chandigarh issue now: Khattar
157.article_body: Talking about the ongoing row between Punjab and Haryana over Chandigarh, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said, "They've (AAP) not been in power for four days and are raising these controversial issues". CM Khattar added, "Chandigarh issue should be resolved by sitting together, it's not something that can be passed unilaterally in Assembly."

158.title: Will protect interest of Supertech twin towers' homebuyers: SC
158.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday said it will protect the interest of homebuyers of Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in its Emerald Court project. The Supreme Court noted submissions of senior advocate S Ganesh, appearing for Supertech's ex-management, that of the 711 homebuyers, claims of 652 homebuyers had been settled. The remaining homebuyers need to be refunded ₹14.96 crore in total.

159.title: Will incur ₹2,285 crore on Central Vista project in FY23: Govt
159.article_body: Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore on Monday said that an estimated ₹2,285 crore will be incurred in FY23 on redevelopment of the Central Vista Avenue. Kishore also denied claims that the project's cost had risen 29% to over ₹1,290 crore. The expenditure incurred on the project till date is ₹418.7 crore, he said.

160.title: Himachal to teach Bhagavad Gita to students from Class 9: Minister
160.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh government will teach Bhagavad Gita to all school students from Class 9, state Education Minister Govind Singh Thakur said. Earlier, the Gujarat government had announced making Bhagavad Gita a part of the school syllabus. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi had also said that every state government can think about introducing Bhagavad Gita as part of school syllabus.

161.title: It's 'jungle raj', never seen such 'anarchy' in Punjab: Sidhu on AAP
161.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said that he's never seen such "anarchy" in Punjab and criticised the Aam Aadmi Party government for unleashing "jungle raj" in the state. "No one is afraid of law and order. Cold-blooded murders are being committed in broad daylight," Sidhu added. He further said that maintaining peace in Punjab should be the priority.

162.title: TN woman confronts molester with safety pin; gets him arrested
162.article_body: A Madras High Court advocate, who was allegedly harassed on a moving bus in Tamil Nadu, confronted the accused with a safety pin before handing him over to the police. The accused had slid his hands through the gap between the seats and touched her inappropriately. He began to shout and abuse when I confronted him, the woman said.

163.title: Oh hi lol: Elon Musk's first tweet after his 9.2% stake in Twitter disclosed
163.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "Oh hi lol," after his 9.2% passive stake in Twitter was disclosed on Monday. According to a regulatory filing, Musk, who has emerged as the biggest shareholder of Twitter, purchased the stake on March 14. Following the news, the shares of Twitter jumped as much as 26%, the most since 2018.

164.title: India's trade deficit rises by 87.5% to $192 billion in 2021-22
164.article_body: India's trade deficit rose by 87.5% from $102.63 billion in 2020-21 to $192.41 billion in 2021-22, government data showed on Monday. While total exports in FY22 rose to a record high of $417.81 billion, imports too soared 54.71% year-on-year to $610.22 billion on the back of rising global fuel and commodity prices. Merchandise imports in FY21 stood at $394.44 billion.

165.title: IndiGo Co-founder, who graduated from IIT Kanpur, gives ₹100 cr to the college
165.article_body: IndiGo airline's Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal, who did his B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Kanpur in 1975, has donated ₹100 crore to the college. The contribution is focused on supporting the School of Medical Sciences & Technology at IIT Kanpur. Indian-American businessman Rakesh Gangwal, his wife and their daughter were present in person for the agreement signing in Mumbai.

166.title: Ukraine's claims of massacre in Bucha 'fake', our troops left on March 30: Russia
166.article_body: Denying allegations of an alleged massacre by Russian forces in Ukraine's Bucha, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that Ukraine staged "another fake attack". He added that Russian armed forces had left the town on March 30. On Saturday, Bucha Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk said that around 300 civilians were killed in a Russian operation. Videos of bodies had surfaced online.

167.title: He's honest: 78-yr-old after transferring assets worth ₹50 lakh in Rahul's name
167.article_body: A 78-year-old woman from Uttarakhand's Dehradun has transferred all her property in Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's name. The woman, Pushpa Munjial, transferred assets worth ₹50 lakh and some gold in Rahul Gandhi's name. She said, "Rahul Gandhi is an innocent, honest man...he'll put my money into things that will be remembered...he's free to spend my money the way he wants."

168.title: Putin should face war crimes trial for atrocities in Ukraine: Biden
168.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday called Vladimir Putin a war criminal and said that he would call for a war crimes trial against the Russian President. Biden's comments come amid a global outcry over atrocities against civilians in Ukraine. The bodies of 410 civilians were removed from towns that were recently retaken from Russian forces, a Ukrainian official said.

169.title: Sri Lanka's economic condition is bad, but India's is worse: Mamata
169.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that India's financial condition is worse than Sri Lanka's and urged the Centre to call for an all-party meeting to address it. "Fuel prices have been hiked 11 times in 13 days. The interest on Provident Fund has been slashed. From railways to banks, everything is being sold off," Mamata said.

170.title: Didn't know role of producer when I joined film industry: Vidya
170.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has revealed that she was not aware of the producer's role in a film when she had started working in the industry. However, Vidya added she realised the producer's role after working in female-led films like 'Ishqiya' and 'No One Killed Jessica'. "The role of a producer and director is equally important for a film," she stated.

171.title: Aamir begins pre-production work of his next film with Ranbir: Report
171.article_body: Aamir Khan has reportedly started working on the pre-production of his upcoming film with Ranbir Kapoor. "This yet-to-be-titled project will be made on a massive scale...will have an important message for...audience," a source was quoted by Pinkvilla. Film's shooting will reportedly begin after the release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Aamir...Ranbir are very excited about the film," the source added.

172.title: I hate 'billionaire' stories, my son's friends look at us differently: Zerodha CEO
172.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol he hates 'billionaire' and 'unicorn' stories. "It creates a wrong image and affects everyone around us like my son's friends, his teachers, our neighbours...they look at us in a different way," Kamath said. "I used to play basketball with the kids and now they...treat me like a billionaire who can't be hurt," he added.

173.title: Krishna has all qualities to be India's successful all-format pacer: Buttler
173.article_body: Praising Prasidh Krishna, England wicketkeeper-batter Jos Buttler said the 26-year-old has got all the qualities to become a "very successful" fast bowler for India in all formats of the game. "He has some pace in...nets and skills...I see him playing red-ball cricket for India as well," he added. Krishna made his international debut in ODI format in March 2021.

174.title: Will ensure police remain ahead of criminals: Shah on Criminal Procedure Bill
174.article_body: Lok Sabha passed the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill by voice vote on Monday. Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the Bill has been brought in to ensure that police and investigators remain two steps ahead of criminals.
