The Bill seeks to provide legal sanction to police to take physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes.

175.title: Nortje returns to training ahead of DC vs LSG, DC shares pic
175.article_body: Ahead of DC-LSG in IPL 2022, DC have posted a picture of pacer Anrich Nortje on Twitter practising in nets on Monday and wrote, "Nortje. Training. That's it. That's the post." Nortje hasn't played since T20I World Cup 2021 due to hip and back injuries. He has to get clearance from Cricket South Africa before making it to playing XI.

176.title: 2 labourers shot by militants in Pulwama, 2nd attack within 24 hrs
176.article_body: A day after two migrant workers were shot at and injured in south Kashmir, suspected militants fired at two more non-local labourers in Pulwama, reports said. The injured labourers have been shifted to the district hospital in Pulwama for treatment and are in stable condition, reports added. Both labourers are from Bihar, reports said.

177.title: Sri Lankan Opp'n rejects Prez's invite to join Cabinet amid crisis
177.article_body: Sri Lanka's largest opposition party, Samagi Jana Balawegaya, rejected an invitation from President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to form a unity government amid the economic crisis. Rajapaksa had invited "all political parties...to come together to accept ministerial portfolios in order to find solutions to this national crisis". All 26 Cabinet Ministers had resigned amid protests against the government.

178.title: Chintu, you've hit last ball out of stadium: Javed on 'Sharmaji...'
178.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar took to Twitter on Monday and praised Rishi Kapoor and Paresh Rawal-starrer 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "Watched 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. So well written and directed. Thank you Paresh saheb for your most unusual and great contribution," Javed tweeted. He further said, "Now my friend Chintu (Rishi), ultimately it's your show. You have hit the last ball out of the stadium."

179.title: Market for nuclear missiles, bombs to surge 73% by 2030: Report
179.article_body: The global market for nuclear missiles and bombs is estimated to surpass $126 billion by 2030, an Allied Market Research report said. This is a nearly 73% rise from the 2020 levels. The report has predicted that the fastest growth in this segment would come from Asia-Pacific region on initiatives by India, Pakistan and China to bolster their nuclear arsenals.

180.title: Our musicians wear body armour instead of tuxedos: Zelenskyy in Grammys address
180.article_body: While appearing in a pre-recorded video at Sunday night's Grammy Awards, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Our musicians wear body armour instead of tuxedos." "They sing to the wounded in hospitals. Even to those who can't hear them. But the music will break through anyway," he added. Zelenskyy urged, "Support us in any way you can...but not silence."

181.title: My high-pitched voice is 'manufacturing defect', I don't get angry: Amit Shah
181.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while speaking in the Lok Sabha on Monday, said, "My high-pitched voice is a manufacturing defect. I don't get angry." He added that he only gets angry on questions related to Kashmir. Shah moved the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022 for consideration and passage in the House.

182.title: Quite emotional: Keshav Maharaj on his 7/32 in 1st Test vs Bangladesh
182.article_body: South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj said he was "quite emotional" after his 7/32 in fourth innings of first Test led his side to a 220-run win against Bangladesh in Durban. Chasing a 274-run target, Bangladesh were bowled out for 53 runs in fourth innings. "Playing at home is always special. Glad...I could take the team over the line," he added.

183.title: It's special to score my ton vs Netherlands with Taylor on other end: Young
183.article_body: New Zealand batter Will Young said it was a "special moment" to have Ross Taylor on the other end when he scored his century (120) in third and final ODI against the Netherlands. The match was Taylor's 450th and last for New Zealand. "I tried to take the pressure off him and allowed him to enjoy the occasion," he added.

184.title: 3 shot dead by armed men over land dispute in Punjab's Gurdaspur
184.article_body: A group of armed men shot dead three persons in Punjab's Gurdaspur district on Monday over an alleged land dispute. The husband of a woman sarpanch, along with two others, was standing in his field, when the group reportedly arrived from Dasuya to take possession of the land. The group opened fire at the victims when they resisted the takeover.

185.title: Paytm Payments Bank yet to appoint firm for IT audit: Govt
185.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said Paytm Payments Bank hasn't yet appointed a firm to conduct an audit of its IT systems. On March 11, RBI barred the bank from onboarding new customers and ordered it to appoint an audit firm. Order followed a report that the bank allegedly leaked data to Chinese entities, Bloomberg reported citing sources.

186.title: FIIs & FPIs may come and go, retail investors take care of markets: FM
186.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that retail investors have brought a shock-absorbing capacity into the Indian markets. "FIIs and FPIs may come and go but today the Indian retail investors have proven that any shock that may come in is now taken care of," she added. Sitharaman further informed Lok Sabha that the inflow of FDI remains unabated.

187.title: PM Modi congratulates Indian composer Ricky Kej for 2nd Grammy win
187.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated Indian music composer Ricky Kej for winning the second Grammy Award. Ricky won the award for 'Divine Tides' in Best New Age Album category. 'Congratulations for this remarkable feat and best wishes for your future endeavours!" PM Modi said in his congratulatory message to Ricky.

188.title: Virat is passionate about his cricket, wants to win every game: Kaul
188.article_body: RCB pacer Siddharth Kaul, in a conversation with Under-19 player Aneeshwar Gautam, said Virat Kohli will give Aneeshwar the "best guidance". "People around the world know about Virat's work ethic and fitness and how he's passionate about his cricket and how he just wants to win every game," Kaul added. Kaul and Virat have played together in the Under-19 team.

189.title: Halsey says 'Had to watch BTS', leaves Grammys early after surgery
189.article_body: Singer Halsey took to Instagram Stories on Sunday to announce that she left the 2022 Grammys early as she was not feeling well but had to see BTS perform before leaving. The South Korean boy band performed their English single 'Butter' at the ceremony. Halsey had earlier announced that she underwent surgery three days ahead of the Grammys.

190.title: My Instagram account hacked or suspended: Aishwarya Rajesh
190.article_body: Tamil actress Aishwarya Rajesh took to Twitter on Monday to announce that her Instagram account has either been hacked or suspended. The actress also tagged Instagram's official handle and asked them to help resolve the issue as soon as possible. This comes a day after actress Yami Gautam announced that her Instagram account may have been hacked.

191.title: Chandigarh belongs to Punjab, next battle for river waters: Sidhu
191.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said Chandigarh belongs to Punjab and will always remain so and added that its next big battle with Haryana will be over river waters. Built on 27 villages of Punjab, Chandigarh was, is and will remain a part of Punjab, Sidhu tweeted in Hindi.

192.title: Ishaan Khatter buys Triumph Bonneville Speed Twin bike worth ₹13 lakh
192.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter on Sunday took to Instagram to share a series of pictures of his new bike Triumph Bonneville Speed Twin which is worth ₹13 lakh. He wrote, "Au naturel with my new love, Speedy Gonzales." His brother Shahid Kapoor commented, "Look at this new biker boy in town," while his mother wrote, "Speedy Gonzales keep my boy safe."

193.title: Crypto payments worth ₹2.2 cr made in 11 drug trafficking cases: Govt
193.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau and Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs have unearthed crypto payments worth ₹2.2 crore in 11 drug trafficking cases, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. Government is taking steps to check such usage, he added. Liaisoning with technical experts and coordination with foreign drug law enforcement agencies is being done regularly, Chaudhary said.

194.title: 'RRR' crosses ₹900 crore-mark globally, only 5th Indian film to do so: Reports
194.article_body: 'RRR' crossed the ₹900-crore mark globally on Sunday, trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan tweeted. The film earned ₹82.40 crore on Sunday, taking its second weekend total to ₹192 crore and overall earnings to ₹901.46 crore. 'RRR' is reportedly the only fifth Indian film to cross the ₹900-crore mark after 'Dangal', 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion', 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' and 'Secret Superstar'.

195.title: No sense for SRH to open the batting with Abhishek Sharma: Chopra
195.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that there is "no sense" for the Sunrisers Hyderabad to use their 21-year-old player Abhishek Sharma as an opening batter. "Don’t open with him [Sharma]. Instead, open with Rahul Tripathi and Washington Sundar...He [Sundar] is being wasted lower down the order...I would bat Abhishek Sharma at 6," Chopra said.

196.title: Russia imposes visa restrictions on citizens of 'unfriendly countries'
196.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree for visa restrictions for citizens of countries that Russia deems "unfriendly" after sanctions over Ukraine. Russia suspended simplified visa issuance regime with some EU countries as well as Norway, Switzerland, Denmark and Iceland. In March, Russia approved a list of "unfriendly countries" including the US, Canada, Britain, EU states and Ukraine.

197.title: Pic of Rajasthan constable running to save child amid Karauli violence surfaces
197.article_body: A photo of a Rajasthan Police constable running past burning buildings while rescuing an infant amid violence in Karauli is being shared on social media. According to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, 31-year-old Netresh Sharma saved the lives of at least four people while performing his duty. Gehlot spoke to the constable and promoted him to the post of Head Constable.

198.title: Guj BJP youth unit to hold 3,000-km march to mark 75 yrs of Independence
198.article_body: The Gujarat BJP's youth unit will hold a statewide march, Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav Yatra, to mark 75 years of Independence. The march will begin on April 6 in Ahmedabad and will conclude on April 25 in Surat. According to Prashant Korat, state president of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha, the 3,000-km long march will have tableaus on Independence-related themes.

199.title: Didn't cry when parents died, cried at Anupam's death in Kashmir Files: Vivek
199.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri shared a behind-the-scenes video from the film's scene depicting Anupam Kher's character Pushkar Nath's death. He wrote, "When my mother died in 2004...When my father died in 2008, I didn't cry. But when I shot this death scene with Anupam Kher I couldn't stop...Such is the intensity of pain of our Kashmiri Hindu parents."

200.title: Sunday meets with fans at Jalsa to be revived perhaps: Amitabh Bachchan
200.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, who called off his weekly meet-and-greet with his fans at Jalsa in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic, has hinted at reviving the meets. Taking to his blog, Amitabh wrote, "News about...Mumbai is that no more masks and protocol of COVID...which comes as a blessing...perhaps the Sunday meets at the Jalsa gate...to be revived."

201.title: It was pretty special: Elgar on SA's 1st Test win against Bangladesh
201.article_body: Describing South Africa's 220-run victory against Bangladesh in the first Test as "pretty special", South Africa captain Dean Elgar said it was a hard-fought win in Durban. "It's not often we've had a Test go into five days...been a hard graft playing in conditions that we're not used to seeing," he added. South Africa are 1-0 ahead in two-match series.

202.title: 2 hikers dead, 2 injured in landslide in Australia's Blue Mountains
202.article_body: Two hikers, including a 9-year-old boy, were killed and two others were critically injured on Monday in a landslide in the Blue Mountains in Australia's New South Wales state. The injured hikers have suffered head and abdominal injuries, paramedics said. The victims are British nationals who were holidaying in Australia, according to a police statement.

203.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz beats Ruud to become youngest Miami Open men's champion
203.article_body: Fourteenth seed Carlos Alcaraz defeated sixth seed Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-4 in Miami Open final to win his first ATP Masters 1000 title on Sunday. Notably, 18-year-old Alcaraz is the youngest Miami men's champion in the event's 37-year-old history and first Spanish man to win in Miami after eight previous final appearances by his compatriots, including five by Rafael Nadal.

204.title: SRH to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs out
204.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash. SRH are fielding the same playing XI that featured in their IPL 2022 opener against RR. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with bowling all-rounder Jason Holder replacing Dushmantha Chameera.

205.title: Woman cheats Pune techie of ₹9 lakh through matrimonial site, arrested
205.article_body: A woman, sought by Pune's Koregaon Park Police on charges of cheating a 36-year-old IT company worker of ₹9.25 lakh last year, has been caught in Goa. According to police, the accused, Reema Sandhu, contacted the victim using a fake profile on a matrimonial website and later asked him to transfer money on pretext of requiring help for legal case.

206.title: Online exams to fill 128 medical posts from 19,015 applications: PCMC
206.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has received 19,015 applications for 128 medical posts, that will be filled through online examinations. All the posts are permanent, but no interviews will be conducted, officials said. Assistant Municipal Commissioner Balasaheb Khandekar said that arrangements are underway to make examination rooms available in different districts.

207.title: Only 10% kids in 12-14 age group COVID-19 vaccinated in Mumbai: BMC
207.article_body: Around 38,365 of the 4 lakh children between 12 and 14 years of age have been vaccinated against COVID-19 in Mumbai, which is only 10% of the targeted population, according to BMC data. Health department officials said the response to the drive, which began on March 16, has been lower than expected due to the dip in the daily cases.

208.title: Free solar mobile charging unit installed in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar
208.article_body: A free solar-powered mobile charging unit has been installed in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar, which is a first in the area. MLC Balaram Patil, who inaugurated the unit at a sector 15 bus stand on the occasion of Gudi Padwa said, "This is a state-of-the-art concept that'll benefit...common man." Earlier, a similar unit was set up in the New Panvel area.

209.title: Ross Taylor breaks down during national anthem in his last int'l match, video viral
209.article_body: Ross Taylor, who played his last international cricket match today, broke down when New Zealand's national anthem was being played ahead of the third ODI against Netherlands. Taylor's children also accompanied him during the national anthem. Taylor played 112 Tests, 236 ODIs and 102 T20Is in his career, scoring 18,195 runs.

210.title: Economic crisis makes Sri Lankan stocks world's worst performers after Russia
210.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis, the country's stocks have fallen about 33% in 2022, making them the world's worst performers after Russian equities. In 2021, the Sri Lanka Colombo Stock Exchange had rallied 80%, posting the world's best performance after Mongolia. On Monday, the central bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal resigned amid soaring inflation and fuel shortage.

211.title: 2nd Grammy win is beautiful recognition of my life choices: Ricky Kej
211.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej said that winning a second Grammy award is a "beautiful recognition" of his life choices. Ricky won the award for 'Divine Tides' in Best New Age Album category. "I feel strongly about making this world...better place, that's the only kind of music that I make," he stated. Ricky won his first Grammy award in 2015.

212.title: Heartbreaking to see what Sri Lanka is going through: Jacqueline
212.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis and emergency, actress Jacqueline Fernandez took to Instagram to support her native country. "As a Sri Lankan, it's heartbreaking to see what my country and countrymen are going through," she wrote. "I'm hoping this situation comes to an end soon and through means which are peaceful and for the benefit of the people," she added.

213.title: Delhi govt will draw summer action plan to fight pollution: Minister
213.article_body: The Delhi government will prepare a 14-point summer action plan to fight pollution in the capital, Environment Minister Gopal Rai said on Monday. He said the plan will focus on open burning of garbage, fires at landfill sites, increasing green cover on the roadside, rejuvenation of water bodies, parks, tree transplantation monitoring, development of an eco-waste park and more.

214.title: Meat shops should be shut during Navratri: South Delhi Mayor to officers
214.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation on Monday issued an order asking officers concerned to take action for the closure of meat shops during Navratri till April 11. The order issued by Mayor Mukkesh Suryaan said, "In these days...sight of meat being sold in open and near temples makes [people] uncomfortable." It added, "Their religious belief and sentiments are also affected."

215.title: Ram Charan gifts gold coins to 35 'RRR' technicians; pics surface
215.article_body: Actor Ram Charan gifted gold coins to nearly 35 unit members of his film 'RRR' after inviting them over for a meal at his residence in Hyderabad. He presented them with sweets and a gold coin, each weighing 11.6 grams, reports said. The technicians included various heads of filmmaking departments like direction and camera, production managers, still photographers, and accountants.

216.title: Ananya Panday and Ishaan Khatter break up after 3 years: Reports
216.article_body: Actors Ananya Panday and Ishaan Khatter have broken up after dating for three years, media reports, including those from Pinkvilla and TOI, said on Monday. "They bonded well on the sets of 'Khaali Peeli' and that led to the beginning of a new journey," Pinkvilla reported. "It has been a mutual call...and things ended on a positive note," it added.

217.title: KGF 2 to be 1st South film to release in Greece, breaks UK pre-sale record
217.article_body: Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' will become the first South Indian film to be released in Greece on April 14. The advance booking for the film began in the UK and sold 5,000 tickets within 12 hours which is the highest ever for any Indian film. 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' will also be released in the US and South America.

218.title: Varun shares old video with Triple H as he retires from WrestleMania
218.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan on Monday took to Instagram to share an old video of him interacting with wrestler Triple H after the latter announced his retirement from WrestleMania. He wrote, "One of my all-time favourite WWE superstars hung up his boots at WrestleMania. I was fortunate enough to...talk to him about my love of pro wrestling and the rock."

219.title: I shut out everyone, was only talking to Rohit and Mahi bhai: Pant on getting dropped
219.article_body: Talking about the time when he was dropped from India's limited-overs squad in 2019, Rishabh Pant said, "It was a hard time...I shut out everyone." "It was difficult for me to go to many people. I wanted to prove myself to the world. I was only talking to Rohit Sharma and Mahi bhai (MS Dhoni) a  little bit," he said.

220.title: CCI orders probe into Zomato and Swiggy
220.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday ordered an investigation into the conduct of online food delivery platforms Zomato and Swiggy. "There exists a prima facie case with respect to some of the conduct of Zomato and Swiggy," the CCI said. The antitrust body will probe allegations including delayed payment cycle, imposition of one-sided clauses and exorbitant commission.

221.title: Vinay Mohan Kwatra to be next Foreign Secretary: Govt
221.article_body: Vinay Mohan Kwatra, India's Ambassador to Nepal, will be the next Foreign Secretary, an official statement said on Monday. The 1988-batch Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer will succeed Harsh Vardhan Shringla, who is set to retire at the end of April. From August 2017 to February 2020, Kwatra had served as the Indian Ambassador to France.

222.title: You've been great ambassador of the game: Tendulkar to Ross on retirement
222.article_body: Calling Ross Taylor a "great ambassador" of the game, Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate the New Zealand batter on his retirement. "It was wonderful playing against you. The way you reinvented yourself over...years to adapt is an inspiration for all...young kids aspiring to be cricketers," he wrote. Taylor played 450 international matches for New Zealand across all formats.

223.title: Car rams into pile of timber on Pune-Mumbai highway; 2 killed
223.article_body: Two people from Thane were killed and one more was seriously injured after their car rammed into a pile of timber on the Pune-Mumbai old highway on Monday, reports said. Inspector Sanjay Jagtap, in-charge of the Kamshet Police Station, said that the container had turned on its side and the timber spilt onto the Mumbai bound lane.

224.title: Russia condemns Poland's comment on hosting US nuclear weapons
224.article_body: Russia on Monday condemned a comment by Polish Deputy PM Jarosław Kaczyński after he said Poland would be open to having US nuclear weapons on its soil. Russia also said that such a move would only lead to heightened tensions in the region. Tensions between Poland and Russia have been high over the conflict in Ukraine.

225.title: KL Rahul has the ability to be the finisher for LSG: Sunil Gavaskar
225.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said LSG captain KL Rahul has the "ability" to be a finisher for his team. "Rahul's not just somebody who can begin the innings...get the team off to...good start. He has all the shots in the book to finish it off as well," Gavaskar added. In IPL 2022, Rahul has scored 40 runs in two matches.

226.title: Pacer Avesh Khan is a fabulous prospect for Team India: Gavaskar
226.article_body: Ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar said LSG pacer Avesh Khan is a "fabulous" prospect for Team India. "Avesh is...very good prospect...don't care what people say about him," Gavaskar stated. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Avesh has scalped three wickets in two matches with the economy being over nine. Avesh has represented India in two T20Is and has taken two wickets.

227.title: 3,697 DTC buses equipped with panic buttons, CCTVs: Delhi govt
227.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said 3,697 Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) buses are equipped with panic buttons and CCTV cameras. He added that as of March 21, 9,181 marshals were also deployed in DTC buses. DTC managed monthly savings of ₹2.32 crore in FY21 with income in the same fiscal at ₹454.42 crore, the Delhi Transport Department said.

228.title: Imran Khan proposes Pakistan's ex-Chief Justice Gulzar Ahmed as caretaker PM
228.article_body: Imran Khan, who was de-notified as the PM of Pakistan, has proposed the name of former Chief Justice Gulzar Ahmed as caretaker PM. Earlier, President Arif Alvi said Khan would continue as PM until the appointment of a caretaker premier. Alvi had also reportedly asked Leader of the Opposition in the outgoing National Assembly, Shehbaz Sharif, to propose a name.

229.title: It's condemnable: K'taka Minister on KTR's 'Move to Hyd' remark
229.article_body: Karnataka Minister CN Ashwathnarayan criticised Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao for suggesting a Bengaluru-based entrepreneur to shift to Hyderabad for better facilities. Ashwathnarayan said it was condemnable. "The tweet wasn't in a good taste...Trying to pull the legs of each other does not go well for any government," Ashwathnarayan added.

230.title: Chhattisgarh tops states with lowest unemployment rate in March: Govt
230.article_body: Chhattisgarh has been ranked first among states with the lowest unemployment rate in the country in March, an official statement said on Monday. "The state government took several steps and formulated new policies for generating employment opportunities, especially for the youth," the release said, citing data by the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy.

231.title: China sends military to help test Shanghai residents for COVID-19
231.article_body: China has sent 2,000 medical personnel from the military to help test the residents of Shanghai amid a COVID-19 outbreak. Thousands of healthcare workers from across China were also sent to Shanghai to help fight one of the biggest COVID-19 outbreaks in the country so far. Authorities had launched mass testing and imposed a lockdown under China's 'zero-COVID' strategy.

232.title: Video shows Russian helicopter splitting into 2 after being hit by Ukrainian missile
232.article_body: A Russian Mi-28 helicopter was seen splitting into two after being hit by a missile launched by Ukrainian forces. A video of the incident surfaced on social media. As per reports, Ukraine used Starstreak, the UK's most advanced manned portable missile system. In March, the UK said it'll supply Ukraine with anti-aircraft missiles to help it defend itself from Russia.

233.title: COVID-19 medicines sold at 5% GST, others at 5-12%: MoS Finance
233.article_body: Pankaj Chaudhary, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Finance, on Monday said that COVID-19 medicines and instruments are being sold at a GST rate of 5%. Other medicines have been sold at a GST rate between 5-12% since the pandemic started, he added. He said the GST rate for health insurance is 18%, which is as per international standards.

234.title: New York street named Ganesh Temple Street after N America's oldest Hindu temple
234.article_body: A street outside a prominent temple in Flushing, Queens Borough in New York has been co-named the Ganesh Temple Street. Queens Borough's President Donovan Richards shared a video of the ceremony. Established in 1977, The Hindu Temple Society of North America Sri Maha Vallabha Ganapati Devasthanam is regarded as the first and oldest Hindu Temple in North America.

235.title: Mission to bring Delhi CM Kejriwal's 'good governance' to B'luru: Rao
235.article_body: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner B Bhaskar Rao joined Aam Aadmi Party on Monday and said that his mission was to bring Delhi Chief Minister's "good governance" to South India, especially Bengaluru. He further stated that he was impressed with Kejriwal's leadership. Rao joined AAP in the presence of Delhi CM Kejriwal and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia.

236.title: Driver killed, 34 injured as Shimla-bound bus hits a wall in Mandi
236.article_body: A roadways bus hit a wall on the Chandigarh-Manali National Highway in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi on Monday, killing the driver and injuring 34 people. The bus was on its way to Shimla from Manali. The injured people were shifted to a nearby hospital, Mandi Superintendent of Police Shalini Agnihotri said.

237.title: College textbook allegedly listing 'Merits of dowry' goes viral; Twitter users react
237.article_body: A snippet of a college textbook listing 'Merits of dowry', claimed to be from a Sociology Book for Nurses, has gone viral on Twitter. The book reads, "Ugly looking girls can be married off with an attractive dowry with well or ugly looking guys." Several Twitter users criticised it with tweets like, "This is making me sick" and "Appalling".

238.title: Elon Musk becomes Twitter's largest shareholder with 9.2% stake
238.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has become the largest shareholder of Twitter after he disclosed that he owns a 9.2% passive stake in the platform. It's more than quadruple the 2.25% stake held by Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey. Notably, Musk conducted a Twitter poll last month asking users whether Twitter adheres to the principle of free speech.

239.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank combined entity will be among world's 100 most-valued firms
239.article_body: The combined entity formed out of the HDFC Bank-HDFC merger will be among the world's 100 most-valued firms in terms of market capitalisation, as per Bloomberg data. The entity will likely be worth $190 billion (over ₹14 lakh crore), making it the 63rd most-valued company globally. Currently, Apple is the world's most-valued company with a market value of $2.84 trillion.

240.title: Let’s focus on infra, not on halal & hijab: KTR to K'taka Cong chief
240.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday replied to Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar, who had said that the party will restore the glory of Bengaluru by 2023. "Let's focus on infrastructure, IT and BT, not on halal and hijab," Rao tweeted. He added, "Let Hyderabad and Bengaluru compete healthily on creating jobs for...youngsters and prosperity for our great nation."

241.title: You left it better than you found it: McCullum on Taylor's retirement
241.article_body: Following New Zealand batter Ross Taylor's retirement after playing his last match in Hamilton, against the Netherlands, Brendon McCullum congratulated him. "You left it better than you found it. 'Gather ye'. May...next stage be as great as the last," he tweeted. The 38-year-old is highest run-scorer for New Zealand in Test and ODI formats with 7,683 and 8,607 runs respectively.

242.title: Indonesian teacher sentenced to death for raping 13 minor girls
242.article_body: An Indonesian court handed down a death sentence to Herry Wirawan, a teacher who raped 13 girls at an Islamic school. He had initially received a sentence of life in prison. Between 2016 and 2021, Wirawan sexually groomed the 13 girls, who were between 12 and 16 years old, and impregnated eight of his victims, a judge said earlier.

243.title: Delhi Police arrests 57, seize 679 litres of liquor in last 24 hrs
243.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 57 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and seized 679 litres of illicit liquor in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 14 proclaimed offenders and recovered seven stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,236 calls, the post added.

244.title: It's not a pan-India film but a 'Hindustani' film: Sanjay on 'KGF 2'
244.article_body: Sanjay Dutt in an interview spoke about his upcoming movie 'KGF: Chapter 2', which will release in multiple languages, including Kannada, Hindi, Tamil, Malayalam and Telugu. He said that it's wrong to call it a Kannada or south movie. Sanjay added it's "not even a pan-India film but a 'Hindustani' film". Directed by Prashanth Neel, the film also stars Yash.

245.title: Shilpa gets trolled for 'ignoring' Harnaaz on 'India's Got...', fan says 'Shameful'
245.article_body: Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Kaur Sandhu recently appeared as a guest on 'India's Got Talent 9'. In a video, Harnaaz is seen walking up to the judges' panel where Shilpa Shetty and Badshah are seated. As Harnaaz approached the judges, they congratulated her for winning the title. However, fans trolled Shilpa for ignoring Harnaaz. One of the users commented, "Shameful".

246.title: Kohli congratulates Taylor on his final int'l game, says you've been a legend
246.article_body: Virat Kohli congratulated New Zealand's Ross Taylor as he played his last international game against the Netherlands on Monday. "Congratulations on a wonderful career...You've been a legend for New Zealand cricket. You have been a great ambassador for the game and we've shared some amazing memories together," said Kohli in a video posted by NZ cricket.

247.title: Mumbai man gets bank’s fake number from internet, loses ₹2.77 lakh
247.article_body: A 61-year-old Mumbai businessman lost ₹2.77 lakh to cyber fraud after he picked up fake number of his bank from the internet. The businessman called up a cyber fraudster while trying to call the bank to activate his credit card. "He [fraudster] said I will receive...OTP...on my phone to update my address...He asked me to share OTP," businessman told police.

248.title: Over ₹53,000 crore owed to states as FY22's GST compensation: Govt
248.article_body: The central government still owes ₹53,489 crore to states and UTs in GST compensation for the period between April 2021 and January 2022, the Finance Ministry said on Monday. Of this, the maximum amount is owed to Maharashtra at ₹11,563 crore. The Centre borrowed ₹1.59 lakh crore in FY22 to make up for the shortfall in GST compensation cess collections.

249.title: Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed within a year: Nitin Gadkari
249.article_body: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways, Nitin Gadkari, has announced that the work on the Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed within a year. The work on the Mumbai-Goa highway is underway in 11 phases. Gadkari said that the initial work on the highway was delayed due to land acquisition and taking permissions from the Railways and Forest Department.

250.title: Bangladesh record their 2nd lowest total in Test cricket history
250.article_body: Bangladesh recorded their second-lowest total in Test cricket history after being dismissed for 53 runs in their second innings in first Test against South Africa in Durban. Only two Bangladeshi batters managed to score in double-digits, with Najmul Hossain Shanto top-scoring with 26 runs. South Africa dismissed Bangladesh in 19 overs using only two bowlers (Keshav Maharaj and Simon Harmer).

251.title: MP's 56-year-old IAS officer Shailbala Martin to marry senior journalist Rakesh Pathak
251.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's 56-year-old IAS officer Shailbala Martin, who's currently posted as Additional Secretary in General Administration department of the state government, will tie the knot with senior journalist Rakesh Pathak. The 57-year-old journalist took to Facebook to announce the news, saying they have been in a relationship for two years. Pathak lost his first wife Pratima to cancer in 2015.

252.title: If everything falls into place, we might make it: 'Baahubali' maker on part 3
252.article_body: 'Baahubali' director SS Rajamouli, during an event, hinted at the possibility of part three in the franchise, saying that the announcement about the project will come at the right time. Reacting to Rajamouli's statement, producer Prasad Devineni said, "Definitely at some point, we might make it, if everything falls into place. But there's no effort being put in right now."

253.title: It's a fact we're not happy: BTS on losing Grammy to Doja Cat
253.article_body: South Korean band BTS held an Instagram Live session on Monday after the 2022 Grammys. The band, whose single 'Butter' was nominated in the best pop duo/group performance category, lost to Doja Cat's 'Kiss Me More'. "It's a fact that we're not happy. But I think it's good to be honest about how we feel," the band's rapper RM said.

254.title: Biden calls for new gun laws as 6 die in California mass shooting
254.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday called on Congress to reform gun laws "urgently" after six people were killed in a mass shooting in California's Sacramento. He said that there should be a ban on "ghost guns" and a requirement for background checks for all gun sales, among others. "We must do more than mourn; we must act," he added.

255.title: Band Foo Fighters wins 3 Grammys week after drummer's death
255.article_body: Rock Band Foo Fighters won all three Grammys that they were nominated in the categories Best Rock Album, Best Rock Performance and Best Rock Song. This comes just over a week after the band's drummer Taylor Hawkins passed at the age of 50. Taylor's body was reportedly found in his hotel room before the band was to perform in Colombia.

256.title: Sometimes press ask stupid questions: John on his outburst at a journalist
256.article_body: John Abraham addressed his angry outburst at a journalist recently during the promotions of his upcoming film 'Attack'. This came after John was asked about 'the unrealistic action sequences in his movies'. Losing his cool, John called the journalist "dumb". Now in a recent interview, John said, "[Sometimes press] ask...stupid questions...I...get riled up when I get asked a stupid question."

257.title: India continues to remain highest receiver of FDI: FM Sitharaman
257.article_body: India has been the highest receiver of foreign direct investment (FDI) since before COVID-19 and continues to be so even now, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. She added that Indian retail investors have created the capacity to absorb shocks due to outflow of foreign funds. Earlier, data showed that foreign portfolio investors withdrew ₹1.48 lakh crore from October 2021-March 2022.

258.title: Russians raped 10-yr-old girls, marked women's bodies with 'swastika burns': Ukraine MP
258.article_body: Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko has claimed Russian soldiers in Ukraine raped girls as young as 10 years old and branded women's bodies with "swastika-shaped burns". She tweeted, "Russian soldiers loot, rape and kill. 10 y.o. girls with vaginal and rectal tears." Vasylenko shared a photo of 'swastika-shaped burn' on the "tortured body of a raped and killed woman" on Twitter.

259.title: $71 billion wiped out of market cap of Singapore's Grab and Sea in 3 months
259.article_body: Singapore's two largest new-economy companies have lost a combined $71 billion from their market capitalisation this year. While shares of ride-hailing company Grab have more than halved in the last three months, technology giant Sea's stock price has plunged by 46%. Sea-owned Shopee recently shut down India operations, whereas its Free Fire game was banned by the Indian government.

260.title: IIT grad attacks policemen with sharp weapon outside Gorakhnath temple
260.article_body: A 29-year-old IIT graduate armed with a sharp-edged weapon was arrested after he attacked two policemen outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Sunday. Identified as Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, he allegedly tried to break into the temple, raising religious slogans. A "terror attack" cannot be ruled out, the UP police said, adding that ATS will probe the incident.

261.title: Nawab Malik's judicial custody extended till April 18
261.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court has extended Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik's judicial custody till April 18 in Mumbai on Monday. Earlier, the special court had allowed Malik to be provided with home-cooked food and medicines during his custody period. Notably, the NCP leader was held in a money laundering case by the Enforcement Directorate in February.

262.title: BSF seizes intruding Pakistani fishing boat off Gujarat coast
262.article_body: The Border Security Force said it seized a Pakistani fishing boat that was intruding into Indian territory near Gujarat's Kutch on Sunday. The BSF said it noticed the movement of two Pakistani boats and four or five fishermen. The patrol chased the fishermen and seized one of the fishing boats about 100 metres inside Indian territory, said BSF.

263.title: I don't know why people take liberties with Alia, Ranbir: Randhir
263.article_body: Veteran actor Randhir Kapoor in an interview has stated that he doesn't know why people take liberties with actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor. He was reacting to the rumours of the couple getting married in April at the RK House. "They are to get married in the RK house? I have heard no such thing," the actor added.

264.title: PBKS can beat strongest sides in IPL 2022: Aakash after win over CSK
264.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra, speaking about Punjab Kings' 54-run win against Chennai Super Kings, has said, "PBKS are a team who can beat the strongest sides." Aakash added that Punjab have looked "destructive" and "explosive" side in the ongoing IPL 2022. "They're in my list of favourites," he stated. PBKS have won two out of their three IPL 2022 matches.

265.title: Harmanpreet's hat-trick helps India beat England 4-3 in FIH Pro League
265.article_body: After winning against England on Saturday, India defeated them again by 4-3 in the FIH Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. Indian defender Harmanpreet Singh was yet again adjudged the 'Player of the Match' for scoring a hat-trick on Sunday. India is now placed at the top of the FIH Pro League table with 21 points from 10 matches.

266.title: Man stabs 75-yr-old landlord to death in Ahmedabad over rent dispute
266.article_body: Police arrested a youth on Saturday night for allegedly stabbing to death his landlord, a 75-year-old man in Memnagar of Ahmedabad, over a rent-related dispute. Vivek Desai, the son of the deceased, in his complaint, mentioned that his father was sitting outside an eatery when the accused came and stabbed him in his stomach and neck.

267.title: Using loudspeakers outside mosques disturbs students, patients: K'taka minister
267.article_body: After Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray opposed to the use of loudspeakers at mosques, Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa on Monday said using loudspeakers to call for prayer disturbs students and patients. "I have no objections to you (Muslims) offering prayers...If prayers are offered at temples and churches in a similar way, it'll lead to conflict between communities," he added.

268.title: I don't say this enough but Aishwarya is an unbelievable mom: Abhishek
268.article_body: When asked if he's the kind of father who helps his daughter Aaradhya Bachchan with her homework, Abhishek Bachchan denied and said, "I tried once or twice but that’s completely Aishwarya. She's an unbelievable mother for her dedication to Aaradhya." "I don't...say that enough, but due to her dedication...I get to go out and do what I do," he added.

269.title: My spin bowling will come into play later in the IPL: Livingstone
269.article_body: Punjab Kings all-rounder Liam Livingstone said that he hopes that his spin bowling will "come into play" as IPL goes on. "Bowling is something I really enjoy. Something I’ve spent a lot of time on. Been nice to contribute," Livingstone said. "Hopefully as the tournament goes on, my spin comes into play," he added after bagging two wickets against CSK.

270.title: During Ramzan, use of sirens by mosques annoys people: Sri Rama Sene
270.article_body: Sri Rama Sene's Siddalinga Swamiji has reportedly asked the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party to take action against those who play 'Azaan' on loudspeakers. "During the time of Ramzan, the use of sirens by mosques also annoys people. The state should step in and take action," he said. Earlier MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of mosque loudspeakers.

271.title: Suspected militants kill 21 civilians in Congo village
271.article_body: At least 21 civilians were killed in Congo's Masambo village in an attack by militants suspected to be from Allied Democratic Forces (ADF), said a human rights group called Ruenzori Sector Civil Society. "It is a miracle I survived. We were already in bed when we heard the sound of boots outside and bullets," said a resident.

272.title: Indian shuttler Mithun Manjunath wins silver at 2022 Orleans Masters
272.article_body: Indian shuttler Mithun Manjunath won a silver medal at the 2022 Orleans Masters in France after losing to Frenchman Toma Junior Popov in the final on Sunday. The world number 79 was defeated by 32nd ranked Popov 21-11, 21-19 in 50 minutes. It was Manjunath's maiden BWF final. Earlier, India's Sai Praneeth, the top seed, lost in the pre-quarterfinals.

273.title: Man United no longer favourites for top 4, says manager Ralf Rangnick
273.article_body: Manchester United interim manager Ralf Rangnick said they're no longer favourites to finish inside the top four of the Premier League after they were held to a 1-1 draw by Leicester City. "For us, it's...our job...to finish this season on the highest and best possible note," he added. United are currently placed 7th on the points table.

274.title: Elon Musk discloses 9.2% stake in Twitter
274.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in Twitter, Bloomberg reported citing a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. Following the news, shares of the social media platform jumped more than 25% in pre-market trading in the US. Musk's stake is worth around $2.89 billion, based on Twitter's closing price on Friday.

275.title: Pant is an important player, no longer in 'can be dropped' category: Rathour
275.article_body: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour has termed India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant as a "mature player", who is no longer in the "can be dropped" category. "Pant has suddenly grown up. Rohit and Dravid are in the saddle now, and they know he's an important player in the India setup," stated Rathour. "Pant is getting better and better," he added.

276.title: Gurugram Police book 2 for kidnapping 2 drivers
276.article_body: Gurugram Police have booked a private company's owner and foreman for allegedly kidnapping two drivers in the district's Bilaspur area on Saturday night. The complaint was lodged by the wife of one of the victims. "It appears that the accused had enmity with two other people, who were known to the victims, from their village," an official said.

277.title: Delhi High Court allows journalist Rana Ayyub to travel abroad
277.article_body: The Delhi High Court has allowed journalist Rana Ayyub to travel abroad but imposed certain conditions. The court has asked her to inform the agencies where she was staying and deposit some money. She was earlier stopped at the Mumbai airport on the basis of a look out circular issued by the ED against her in a money laundering case.

278.title: I slap back: Vir reacts to troll who says he deserves a slap like Chris Rock
278.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das reacted to a troll who said he "deserves to be" slapped like Chris Rock. This came after Vir shared a picture of his dishevelled hair, and jokingly wrote. "There's mutiny [in]...hair." Commenting on it, a user wrote, "Someone needs to do a Will Smith on this one. Responding to this, Vir wrote, "Just know I slap back."

279.title: Sri Lanka Prez names 4 ministers after Cabinet members resigned
279.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday appointed four ministers after members of the Cabinet resigned amid the ongoing economic crisis in the country. Ali Sabry has been named as the new Finance Minister, replacing Basil Rajapaksa, while GL Peiris will reportedly continue as the Foreign Minister. The previous ministers of Education and Highway have reportedly been retained.

280.title: Payal apologises to Muslims after calling Zeeshan terrorist on 'Lock Upp'
280.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi has apologised to Indian Muslims with folded hands for hurting their sentiments on reality show 'Lock Upp'. This comes after her fight with fellow contestant Zeeshan Khan during which she said he is disgusting for promoting halal meat and called him a terrorist. Zeeshan told Payal to get her lawyer ready for taking it to another level.

281.title: 14-year-old girl repeatedly raped for 25 days in Gwalior
281.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was repeatedly raped for 25 days by a 23-year-old man she met online eight months ago, police said. The girl had gone missing on March 7 after leaving the house to meet a friend. Based on the location of the victim's mobile phone and CCTV camera footage, police rescued her and arrested the accused from Hastinapur.

282.title: Not forcing hijab-clad teachers for exam duty: Karnataka Edu Min
282.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that teachers who "insist on wearing hijab" will not be forced to take up the exam invigilator's role. "As hijab is not allowed inside...We have given them the option to take exam duty or not," Nagesh said. Notably, seven teachers have been suspended for allowing hijab-clad students to sit for the board exam.

283.title: Will restore B'luru's glory as best city: Shivakumar; KTR says, 'challenge accepted'
283.article_body: Responding to Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao's tweet asking a startup to shift its base from Bengaluru to Hyderabad owing to the latter's "better infrastructure", Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar said he "accepts Rao's challenge". "By 2023-end, with Congress back in power...we'll restore the glory of Bengaluru as India's best city," Shivakumar added. "Challenge accepted," said Rao in reply.

284.title: I can't be on board of merged bank, I've crossed 75 yrs of age: HDFC Chairman
284.article_body: HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Monday that he will not be on the board of the merged entity, once HDFC combines with HDFC Bank. "The RBI does not allow anyone above the age of 75 years to be on the board of a bank. I have already crossed that age," the 77-year-old said. Parekh had joined HDFC in 1978.

285.title: 14-year-old boy killed in animal attack in Sanjay Tiger Reserve in MP
285.article_body: A 14-year-old boy was mauled to death by an unidentified wild animal in the Sanjay Tiger Reserve (STR) in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district, forest officials said on Monday. Villagers claimed that the boy was killed in the attack by a tiger. The victim's body was found near a river, where he had taken his cattle to graze.

286.title: 'Halal' definitely not for anybody outside of Islam: Lucky Ali on halal controversy
286.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali wrote on Facebook, "Halal is definitely not for anybody outside of Islam." He said, "Muslims won't buy any product just like Jewish who understand Halal as being similar to Kosher and won't buy products that aren't certified." He added, "Companies want to sell...to everyone...If people are...so bothered by the word 'halal'...they should remove it from their counters."

287.title: Team of 2022 Women's World Cup announced, no Indian included
287.article_body: The ICC have announced the Team of 2022 Women's World Cup, which doesn't feature any Indian player. Australia skipper Meg Lanning has been named the captain of the side. The team also features tournament's top two run-scorers, Australia's Alyssa Healy and Rachael Haynes. The team also includes Bangladesh's Salma Khatun, the only Asian in the XI.

288.title: New Royal Enfield bike explodes after catching fire in Andhra Pradesh, video surfaces
288.article_body: A video surfaced online showing a new Royal Enfield bike exploding after catching fire in Anantapur district of Andhra Pradesh. The bike was parked outside a temple when the incident happened. The cause of the fire hasn't been ascertained yet. As per reports, the owner of the bike had ridden it non-stop for around 390 km to reach the temple.

289.title: Sensex ends 1,335 points higher at 60,612, HDFC & HDFC Bank gain 9% each
289.article_body: The Sensex jumped 1,335 points to end at 60,612 on Monday, while the broader Nifty 50 surged 383 points to end at 18,053. HDFC and HDFC Bank, which surged over 9% each following their merger announcement, were the top Sensex gainers. With Sensex reclaiming 60,000-mark on Monday, investors' wealth has increased by ₹30 lakh crore in nearly a month.

290.title: Sharvari to star alongside Aamir Khan's son Junaid in Yash Raj's next: Reports
290.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh will reportedly star alongside Aamir Khan's son Junaid Khan in Siddharth P Malhotra's directorial venture, 'Maharaja'. When asked about it, Sharvari said, "I have a film with Yash Raj that will hopefully release this year." Sharvari revealed she's drawn towards historical dramas. "History intrigues me. I want to do movies that blend mythology and history," she added.

291.title: Sri Lankan President sacks brother & Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa amid crisis
291.article_body: A day after all 26 Cabinet Ministers of Sri Lanka resigned, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa sacked his brother and Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa amid the country's worst economic crisis. Basil had negotiated the Indian economic relief package to help Sri Lanka tackle the foreign exchange crisis. He has now been replaced by Ali Sabry, who was the Justice Minister till Sunday.

292.title: As son grows older, he acquires father's business: Parekh on HDFC-HDFC Bank merger
292.article_body: After HDFC announced that it'll merge itself with HDFC Bank, its Chairman Deepak Parekh said, "It's a merger of equals. It's a friendly...not at all hostile. And, we are one." "As the son grows old, he acquires the father's business...That's all happening here, nothing more," Parekh added. HDFC was founded in 1977, while HDFC Bank was set up in 1994.

293.title: Mika abuses journo who asked if Rakhi will be part of his Swayamvar
293.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, who will be looking for a bride in upcoming show 'Swayamvar - Mika Di Vohti', abused and insulted a journalist who asked him if Rakhi Sawant will be a part of the show, reported SpotboyE. As per the report, the journalist asked him the question at a press meet and Mika later insulted him in a room.

294.title: I would really like to explore B'wood scene while I'm here: Matteo Bocelli
294.article_body: Italian opera singer Andrea Bocelli's son Matteo Bocelli, who's in India, has said he's "delighted to be here". He's collaborating with Amaal Mallik and Prakriti and Sukriti Kakar for a new song. When asked if he knows anything about Indian music, Matteo said, "Not as much as I'd like! I'd really like to explore the Bollywood scene while I'm here."

295.title: Bishnoi accepts challenges, not afraid to bowl to big batters: Jaffer
295.article_body: Talking about Lucknow Super Giants spinner Ravi Bishnoi, ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer opined that the bowler accepts challenges and is not afraid to bowl to "big batters". "Bishnoi has a great temperament...Even if he gets hit, you can expect him to make a comeback," Jaffer added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Bishnoi has picked up two wickets in two matches.

296.title: Gurugram civic body prepares plan to decongest Sadar Bazar
296.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has prepared a plan to reduce congestion in Sadar Bazar. One of the measures in the plan aims to reduce the number of street vendors in the market, with shopkeepers allowing them to operate facing a ₹5,000 fine. A shopkeeper violating the rule for third time will have his shop sealed, an official said.

297.title: I learnt one scene for 1.5 years, coloured my hair 4 times: Alia on 'RRR'
297.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she learnt one scene for one and a half years for the first time for the movie 'RRR' because of the COVID-19 lockdown. "My hair colour was...in continuity for another film...I had to...have darker hair...So I coloured hair, but...highlights were still visible," she said, while mentioning that she had to colour her hair four times.

298.title: Indian-American producer Joseph Patel's film wins Best Music Film at Grammys
298.article_body: Indian-American producer Joseph Patel's 'Summer of Soul' bagged a Grammy in the Best Music Film category on Sunday. It also won the Best Documentary Feature at the Oscars this year. The film, 'Summer Of Soul' is directed by Ahmir Thompson who is known by his stage name Questlove. Joseph backed the movie along with producers Robert Fyvolent and David Dinerstein.

299.title: We're lucky to have Dhoni’s experience, guidance: CSK skipper Jadeja
299.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said his side is lucky to have MS Dhoni's experience and guidance. "We don't have to look far for advice...We have his experience to rely on in the dressing room," Jadeja added. Speaking about three consecutive losses in the ongoing IPL 2022, Jadeja stated, "In T20 cricket, it's...matter of one match. One win can change things."

300.title: Mumbai metro faces technical glitch 2 days after inauguration
300.article_body: Mumbai metro's Dahisar East-Andheri East metro corridor was hit with a technical glitch on Monday, two days after the service was inaugurated. "Due to technical error, train at Magathane towards Aarey has been withdrawn from service," Maha Mumbai Metro Operation Corporation Limited (MMMOCL) tweeted. On the Dahisar East-Andheri East corridor, trains currently operate between Aarey and Dahisar East.

301.title: 55,000 people travel on new Mumbai Metro lines 2A & 7 on 2nd day
301.article_body: As many as 55,000 people travelled on the newly-inaugurated Mumbai Metro lines 2A and 7 on the second day of operations on Sunday. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray had flagged off both the lines on Saturday. An official said that while there was no rush in the day, the Metro started getting crowded on Sunday evening.

302.title: Russia claims video of bodies in Ukraine's Bucha 'ordered to blame it'
302.article_body: Russian foreign ministry spokesperson claimed on Sunday that the footage of Ukraine's Bucha was released in a plot to blame Russia. The spokesperson was referring to the video of dead bodies lying on Bucha's streets. The spokesperson also said that West's statements, "made in the first minute" after the footage appeared, "leaves no doubt as to who 'ordered' this story".

303.title: Shein's valuation would top H&M and Zara combined with $1 billion funding
303.article_body: Chinese fashion e-commerce startup Shein is in talks to raise $1 billion and could do so at a valuation that would be more than the combined worth of H&M and Zara. Shein is seeking a valuation of about $100 billion, Bloomberg reported. Following the funding, Shein would become the world’s most-valuable startup after ByteDance and SpaceX, as per CB Insights.

304.title: We've seen how Dhoni has won such matches: RP Singh on CSK's 54-run loss
304.article_body: Following CSK's 54-run loss against PBKS in IPL 2022, RP Singh said everyone has seen in the past how MS Dhoni has won such matches for his side. "Anything is possible when Dhoni is at...crease," he added. Chasing 181 to win, CSK were reduced to 36/5 when Dhoni (23) joined Shivam Dube (57). They stitched a 62-run sixth wicket partnership.

305.title: AR Rahman, son Ameen meet BTS at Grammy Awards; Ameen shares pics
305.article_body: Music composer AR Rahman attended 64th Annual Grammy Awards at MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas with his son, AR Ameen. Taking to Instagram, Ameen shared some pictures where he and his father are seen posing with the members of South Korean boy band BTS. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Ask BTS to collab with your dad."

306.title: 40 booked for pelting stones during clash between 2 communities in K'taka
306.article_body: At least 40 unidentified persons have been booked over a clash near a mosque in a village in Karnataka's Raichur district on Sunday. Police said some Hindu persons were playing Holi around the mosque when members of the Muslim community objected to this, which led to a clash. Both the sides pelted stones and exchanged profanities, according to police.

307.title: Pune man arrested for selling over 500 jeans with fake labels of a brand
307.article_body: A shopkeeper has been arrested by the Pimpri-Chinchwad Police for allegedly selling 512 duplicate jeans with fake labels of a brand. The 26-year-old accused person is a resident of Morwadi and runs a garments shop in Pimpri. Police have registered an FIR against him under relevant sections of the Copyright Act, 1957.

308.title: Climate change activists block oil facility near London airport
308.article_body: About 30 climate change activists from the Extinction Rebellion group claimed to have blocked the entrance of an oil facility near London's Heathrow Airport on Monday. The blocking of the Esso West oil facility was part of a nationwide campaign to force the government to limit the use of fossil fuels. "Climate action cannot wait," said an activist.

309.title: Ram Charan surprises fans at Mumbai theatre, gets mobbed; pics surface
309.article_body: Actor Ram Charan surprised his fans when he visited a Mumbai theatre on Sunday. Reports said fans went crazy as soon as he stepped out of car and wanted to take a picture with him. Ram Charan, who is scheduled to visit Sabarimala Temple, was spotted barefoot at theatre. In pictures that have surfaced, he can be seen greeting fans.

310.title: Businessman, friend robbed at gunpoint in Delhi's Shahadra
310.article_body: A businessman and his friend were allegedly robbed at gunpoint when the duo were walking towards the Yamuna Sports Complex in Delhi on Sunday. The businessman, 29, alleged that two bike-borne men came and threatened him with a pistol and fled with his gold bracelet, the Deputy Commissioner of Police (Shahdara) R Sathiyasundaram said.

311.title: HDFC Bank-HDFC merger may create India's 2nd-largest company, beating TCS
311.article_body: HDFC and HDFC Bank saw their combined market capitalisation surpass that of India's second-most valued company, TCS, on Monday. Following the announcement that HDFC will merge itself with HDFC Bank, both stocks surged over 9% each during intraday trade. At around 2:30 pm, HDFC Bank's market value stood above ₹9.1 lakh crore, while HDFC's m-cap was at ₹4.80 lakh crore.

312.title: Divine becomes first homegrown Indian hip hop star to attend Grammys, shares pics
312.article_body: Rapper Divine has become the first homegrown Indian hip hop star to attend the Grammy Awards. Sharing pictures from Grammys on Instagram, Divine wrote, "Rap royalty." In an official statement about his Grammys debut, Divine said, "Surreal to be at the Grammys with among some of the best in the world!"

313.title: I'll keep only 1% of my earnings: FTX's 30-yr-old crypto billionaire worth $20 bn
313.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, told Bloomberg that he'll "keep enough money to maintain a comfortable life: 1% of his earnings or, at minimum, $100,000 a year." Bloomberg added, "Other than that, he plans to give it all away—every dollar, or Bitcoin." Sam Bankman-Fried has a net worth of over $20 billion.

314.title: After 45 years, we have found a home within our own family: HDFC Chairman
314.article_body: After announcing the merger of HDFC with HDFC Bank, Chairman Deepak Parekh said he spent "two sleepless nights" prior to the development. "After 45 years of housing finance and 9 million homes provided to Indians, we had to find a home for ourselves. We have found it within our own family and in our own bank," Parekh further said.

315.title: 30-yr-old crypto billionaire drives Corolla, sleeps on bean bag & has 10 roommates
315.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, "lives like a college student", sleeps on a bean bag and drives a Toyota Corolla, Bloomberg reported. "When he's not at the office, he crashes at an apartment with 10 roommates, though it's a penthouse," Bloomberg added. Sam, worth over $20 billion, is currently living in the Bahamas.

316.title: I hate talking on phone: Ajay Devgn on constantly changing number
316.article_body: Ajay Devgn has revealed that he is constantly changing his number, adding he hates talking on the phone. He further said he doesn't like to speak unless it's necessary. As per a report, Preity Zinta and Priyanka Chopra also keep changing their phone numbers. However, Aishwarya Rai, Kareena Kapoor and Akshay Kumar have reportedly had the same number for years.

317.title: 18-yr-old boy drowns while swimming with friends in Pune's Khadakwasla dam
317.article_body: An 18-year-old boy drowned while swimming with his friends in the Khadakwasla dam in Pune on Sunday, police said. The fire brigade rescuers were called and his body was fished out later, the police added. The boy, who was from Ahmednagar, had gone to the dam for a picnic with his friends.

318.title: SRH can't change the auction, but need to play better now: Jaffer
318.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said SRH can't change what happened at the auction but captain Kane Williamson can get better performances out of his players in their upcoming matches. "SRH were tactically poor (against RR), sent Pooran ahead of Markram, didn't bowl Washington much," Jaffer explained. SRH lost their first game against RR by 61 runs.

319.title: Rahul shares chart comparing cost of full tank of fuel in vehicles in 2014 & now
319.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has shared a chart comparing the cost of a full tank of fuel in different vehicles in 2014 and now. According to him, it costed ₹714 for a full tank of fuel in a bike, compared to ₹1,038 now. It costed ₹2,856 for a full tank of fuel in car in 2014, compared to ₹4,152 now.

320.title: Rather than blocking, I mute Instagram accounts to avoid negativity: Ananya
320.article_body: In an interview, actress Ananya Panday was asked whether her relationship with social media has changed over the years, to which she replied, "Because of my recent discovery of the mute feature on Instagram, I choose what I want to see and absorb." Ananya added that she uses the "mute" feature instead of "blocking or unfollowing" someone to avoid negativity.

321.title: UP CM suspends SDM accused of beating clerk to death in Pratapgarh
321.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday suspended Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Gyanendra Singh after he, along with four others, was booked for beating a 57-year-old tehsil clerk to death in Pratapgarh. No arrests have reportedly been made in the case so far. According to the post-mortem, the victim died of "septicaemic shock due to ante mortem lung infection".

322.title: 24-yr-old Punjab man missing since April 2 dies of drug overdose, 3 held
322.article_body: Three people were arrested after a 24-year-old man, Sanpreet Singh, who worked at a hospital in Punjab's Ludhiana died due to drug overdose, reports said. Sanpreet's father said his son had left home on Saturday but did not return home, following which, he was spotted with those arrested. Sanpreet was later found unconscious and hospital declared him dead on arrival.

323.title: Bengaluru reports zero new COVID-19 deaths for 3 consecutive days
323.article_body: Bengaluru has reported zero new coronavirus deaths for three days consecutively, according to official data for Sunday. The city also recorded 49 new coronavirus cases with a positivity rate of 1.2% on the same day, the data showed. The total number of new vaccinations was 6,937, while tests done were 4,080, the data also showed.

324.title: Rohit would've led Deccan Chargers had it not been for auction: Ojha
324.article_body: Former India spinner Pragyan Ojha has revealed that Deccan Chargers captain Adam Gilchrist had identified Rohit Sharma as his successor at the franchise. "Had there been no auction after the third season, then probably Rohit would have led the Deccan Chargers side before leading the Mumbai Indians team. Because Gilchrist had already said 'Rohit is ready now'," stated Ojha.

325.title: Sonam Kapoor flaunts baby bump in new pics; fan calls her a 'Stunning mom'
325.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor shared new pictures on Instagram, where she can be seen flaunting her baby bump. She donned her mother Sunita Kapoor's white satin saree with a sleeveless bralette blouse alongside a long necklace with statement earrings. Sharing the photos, Sonam wrote, "Last night for...@abujani1's birthday evening." One of the fans commented on her post, and wrote, "Stunning mom."

326.title: University students write to Maha CM, object against offline exams
326.article_body: Several students of various Maharashtra-based universities have written to CM Uddhav Thackeray to conduct the upcoming summer examinations in online mode. The students have even launched a Twitter campaign, especially after some of the state-run universities decided to conduct offline exams by terming online exams a "temporary arrangement". "We are not prepared for offline exams," a student said.

327.title: Punjab man killed as jeep hits scooter after ramming into golgappa cart
327.article_body: One man was crushed to death and his wife was injured after a jeep hit their scooter in Punjab's Ludhiana. Reports said that the jeep was trying to run away after ramming into a golgappa cart and injuring the vendor. The man died on the spot while his wife was rushed to the hospital and suffered multiple injuries, including fractures.

328.title: TMC's Derek O'Brien pushes for Women's Reservation Bill in RS
328.article_body: TMC's Derek O'Brien submitted a notice under Rule 168 in the Rajya Sabha for introduction of the Women's Reservation Bill this week in Parliament. "Open dare to the government. Introduce the long-pending Women Reservation Bill in Rajya Sabha this week (before April 8). Accept and put to vote motion under Rule," O'Brien tweeted.

329.title: Olivia Rodrigo mistakenly drops and breaks her Grammy Award, her reaction goes viral
329.article_body: US' 19-year-old singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo, who won three awards at Grammys 2022, mistakenly dropped and broke one of the trophies in the press room. Olivia looked stunned as the trophy broke, with her reaction going viral. Olivia won Grammy for 'Best New Artist', 'Best Pop Vocal Album' for 'Sour' and 'Best Pop Solo Performances' for her hit 'Drivers License'.

330.title: 10-year-old Manipur girl attends school with 2-year-old sister in lap, pic goes viral
330.article_body: A photo of a 10-year-old Manipuri girl attending school with her 2-year-old sister in her lap has gone viral online. The Class 4 girl, Meiningsinliu Pamei, was babysitting her sister as their parents were out for farming. Manipur minister Biswajit Singh tweeted, "Her dedication for education is what left me amazed!", adding he'll take care of her education till graduation.

331.title: Rajya Sabha faces 2nd adjournment amid Opposition ruckus over price hike
331.article_body: The Rajya Sabha on Monday faced a second consecutive adjournment till 2 pm following the ruckus created by the Opposition parties against rising prices of petroleum products and essential commodities across India. The House was adjourned a few minutes after it assembled at noon today following a similar adjournment over the issue.

332.title: Khushi Kapoor wishes Varun's niece Anjini Dhawan on b'day, shares pic
332.article_body: Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor took to her Instagram Stories to wish actor Varun Dhawan's niece Anjini Dhawan on her birthday. She shared a picture of herself with Anjini and wrote, "Happy birthday to my heart Anjini Dhawan." Khushi will make her Bollywood debut with Zoya Akhtar's upcoming live-action musical film based on Archie Comics.

333.title: 2 Kerala fire officials suspended, 3 shifted for training PFI team
333.article_body: The Kerala government suspended two fire safety officials and transferred three others for training rescue and relief team of Popular Front of India (PFI) workers in Aluva in Ernakulam district. A circular from the office of CM Pinarayi Vijayan said that the government viewed the incident seriously. The regional and district fire officers, Ernakulam, have been suspended on pending enquiry.

334.title: Serious offence but Ashish Mishra not a flight risk: UP govt to SC
334.article_body: The UP government on Monday told the Supreme Court that while the "alleged offences are serious", Ashish Mishra, accused in farmers' killings in Lakhimpur Kheri, is not a flight risk. The apex court, which was hearing a plea seeking cancellation of bail granted to Mishra, MoS Ajay Mishra Teni's son, has reserved its order.

335.title: Mumbai man gets 3-yr jail term for groping 13-yr-old girl inside building lift
335.article_body: A 27-year-old man has been sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment for groping his 13-year-old neighbour inside their building's lift in Mumbai, in 2015. A fine of ₹10,000 has also been imposed on him, which is to be given to the minor girl as compensation. The girl shared the incident with her school friend, who then informed the principal.

336.title: Please try and help: Sri Lankan Opposition leader to PM Modi
336.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa while speaking to ANI on Monday requested PM Narendra Modi to please try and help the country "to the maximum possible extent". He also called the resignation of the country's 26 Cabinet Ministers amid the economic crisis a "melodrama to fool people". The resignations aren't a "genuine effort" to bring people relief, he said.

337.title: Sheldon Jackson has got an MS Dhoni sort of a feel: KKR coach McCullum
337.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has praised Sheldon Jackson for his wicketkeeping skills, stating that the 35-year-old has got "an MS Dhoni sort of a feel". McCullum added, "Jackson's wicketkeeping skills have been superb...really fast hands." Sheldon was dropped from KKR's playing XI for their third game against PBKS after he scored 3 runs in the first two games.

338.title: One of biggest EV rallies ever conducted at Pune conclave: Aaditya
338.article_body: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday tweeted that 400 electric vehicles (EVs), including two, three and four-wheelers participated in the EV rally at the Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave. He said that this makes it "one of the biggest EV rallies ever conducted". "This showcases Maharashtra's encouraging transition to clean mobility for long term, sustainable development," he added.

339.title: IMD predicts severe heatwave conditions in Delhi this week
339.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted severe heatwave conditions in Delhi this week. "By Wednesday, Delhi will...see calm conditions and clear skies, leading to mercury touching or crossing the 40°C-mark in most places," weather scientist RK Jenamani said. "No rain is expected in the first and second weeks of April. Therefore, temperatures are expected to rebound," he added.

340.title: Cardi B deletes Twitter account during Grammys 2022, calls her fan base 'f*****g dumba**'
340.article_body: American rapper Cardi B deleted her Twitter account during the Grammy Awards 2022 ceremony after being criticised by her fan base for not attending the event. Before deleting the account, she tweeted, "I hate this f*****g dumb*** fan base. You got the slow dumba***s dragging my kids all cause y'all thought I was going to...Grammys and I didn't the f**k?"

341.title: Prize money for all 8 teams at 2022 Women's World Cup revealed
341.article_body: Winners Australia received a total prize money of $1,495,000, which includes $175,000 for winning all their seven group stage matches and $1,320,000 for winning the tournament. Runners-up England won $700,000, while losing semi-finalists South Africa and West Indies received $437,500 and $387,500 respectively. India got $145,000 from the total prize money pool of $3.5 million.

342.title: Kanye wins two Grammys despite being banned from performing at the ceremony
342.article_body: Rapper Kanye West won two awards at the 2022 Grammys despite being banned from performing at the event. He won Best Rap Song for his track 'Jail'  as well as the Best Melodic Rap Performance for 'Hurricane'. The cancellation of his performance happened due to his troubling social media posts, which allegedly included harassing ex-wife Kim Kardashian's boyfriend Pete Davidson.

343.title: Actors Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary blessed with a baby girl, share video
343.article_body: Actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary have been blessed with a baby girl. The couple shared a video showing the hand of the newborn, writing, "With utmost gratitude we welcome our 'baby girl' into this world. 3.4.2022...Thank you for all your love and blessings." The duo are already parents to daughters Pooja and Lata, whom they had adopted in 2017.

344.title: Silly goose: Khloe Kardashian to user who accused her of having butt implants
344.article_body: American television personality Khloe Kardashian replied to an Instagram user who accused her of having butt implants in the comment section of her workout video. "You can see...implants when stretching. A second layer of her bum on top of her bum," the user wrote. "Lol, silly goose. It's...seam design of...leggings. You guys just want to believe anything bad," Khloe responded.

345.title: Told mom I'd win Grammy when I was 9, she thought it was kid pipe dream: Olivia
345.article_body: American singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo, who attended her first-ever Grammys and won three trophies after being nominated in seven categories, said that she had told her mother that she would win a Grammy award when she was nine years old. "She was very supportive even though I'm sure she thought it was just a little-kid pipe dream," she added.

346.title: Gangster's father attempts self-immolation at Punjab police station
346.article_body: A gangster's father suffered 30% burns after he attempted self-immolation outside a police station in Punjab's Ludhiana on Sunday over his son being shot. A shopkeeper had shot the gangster last year when the latter allegedly tried to extort money. The father claimed that police were reluctant to take action against the shopkeeper. Police officers had immediately doused the fire.

347.title: Sri Lanka’s central bank Governor resigns amid economic crisis
347.article_body: Sri Lanka's central bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal on Monday resigned from his post amid the economic crisis the country is facing. "In the context of all Cabinet Ministers resigning, I have today submitted my resignation as Governor," he said in a Twitter post. Earlier, several ministers, including the prime minister's son, resigned from the Cabinet.

348.title: Imran Khan names US diplomat who sent 'threatening message' to him
348.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has revealed that Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs Donald Lu had sent a threatening message to him through Pakistan's Ambassador Asad Majeed. Khan claimed that Lu warned Majeed there would be implications if the Pakistan PM survived the no-confidence vote. Khan added that the no-trust motion against him was a "conspiracy".

349.title: Uttarakhand deploys 3 shooters to hunt man-eater tiger in Nainital
349.article_body: The state forest department has hired three shooters to hunt down a man-eater tiger that has killed six people in the past three months in Uttarakhand's Nainital district.
