"Three teams have also been deployed to tranquillise the tiger," said CS Joshi, DFO, Ramnagar forest division, Nainital. Notably, the three hunters are Ashish Das Gupta, Kirnesh Jung and Sayyad Ali Hadi.

350.title: Jagan Mohan Reddy inaugurates 13 new districts of Andhra Pradesh
350.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy inaugurated 13 new districts in the state via video conferencing on Monday, taking the total number of districts in the state to 26. Reddy said the creation of more districts is a key step towards decentralised development of all regions. "There will be better governance, peace, security and transparency," the CM added.

351.title: Govt is not realising that country is under inflation: Mallikarjun Kharge
351.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said that the government is not realising that the country is under inflation. "We will raise the issue in the House. Other political parties will also raise the issue, including the hike in fuel prices," Kharge added. Earlier, Kharge said the hike in fuel prices directly affects the cost of all other commodities.

352.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, to now cost ₹64.11 per kg
352.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Monday. CNG will now cost ₹64.11 per kg in the national capital. "In view of the CNG price hike, we are not in favour of switching on the cab's air conditioner for passengers," a city-based cab driver told ANI.

353.title: AAP can’t dare to look at Haryana: CM Manohar Lal Khattar
353.article_body: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said AAP has double standards. "Despite being in rule for a few days (in Punjab), they have raised the controversial issue of Chandigarh. I feel they are doing so on someone else's commands...They can't dare to even look at Haryana," Khattar added.

354.title: IAS officer dances to 'Nagada Sang Dhol' with Kerala students, video viral
354.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, IAS officer and Pathanamthitta District Collector Divya Iyer can be seen dancing to the song 'Nagada Sang Dhol' along with students during a flash mob in Kerala. The performance happened during an event that was organised in the district stadium for the announcement of "Mahatma Gandhi University Art Festival".

355.title: Scenes from horror movie: Ukraine official on bodies on town roads
355.article_body: Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych on Sunday said that the dead civilian bodies seen lying on streets in towns near Kyiv after the withdrawal of some Russian troops were like "scenes from a horror movie". This comes as the country's authorities accused Russia of war crimes. Earlier, Mayor of Bucha said that 280 people were buried in a mass grave.

356.title: UN chief calls for probe into mass killings in Ukraine’s Bucha
356.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for an independent probe into the mass killings of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha after pictures of bodies strewn on streets surfaced. "I am deeply shocked by the images of civilians killed in Bucha, Ukraine," he said. UN official Osnat Lubrani said Ukrainians have been enduring a living hell for more than a month.

357.title: Justin, Hailey Bieber attend Grammys 2022 post her health scare; pics surface
357.article_body: Hailey Bieber attended the 2022 Grammy Awards alongside her husband-singer Justin Bieber, less than a month after being hospitalised due to a blood clot in her brain. The couple shared a kiss as they made a red carpet appearance. Several pictures of the duo have surfaced online, where Justin donned an oversized suit jacket, while Hailey wore a strapless gown.

358.title: 7 houseboats gutted in fire at Srinagar’s Nigeen Lake
358.article_body: Seven houseboats were destroyed in a fire that broke out at the Nigeen Lake in Srinagar in the early hours of Monday. The fire broke out on one of the houseboats anchored at the rear side of the Nigeen Club on the lake and quickly spread to adjacent houseboats. There was no loss of life in the incident, officials said.

359.title: AR Rahman attends Grammys 2022 with his son Ameen, shares pics
359.article_body: Two-time Grammy Award-winner, music composer AR Rahman, attended the Grammy Awards 2022 with his son AR Ameen. Rahman shared a selfie while seated beside his son during the Grammys ceremony, while in another picture captioned "Parenting", Rahman can be seen gracing the red carpet of the event with his son. Ameen also shared pictures of himself with BTS members.

360.title: 52.7% Chandigarh residents unaware of cybercrimes: Survey
360.article_body: According to a two-month-long survey conducted by the Chandigarh Cyber Crime Investigation Cell, at least 52.7% of the residents lack knowledge about the various kinds of cybercrimes. About 80% of participants received fraud messages/calls and 20.3% of them preferred to report to the police, as per the survey. Exactly 57.9% of them preferred to ignore the calls/messages.

361.title: 7th edition of 'Musicathon' to be held in Bir on April 15th and 16th
361.article_body: The seventh edition of Musicathon will be held in Himachal Pradesh's Bir on April 15th and 16th. "With the most outstanding location and ultra talented indie artists, we are ready to celebrate art, music, love, people and nature..with you all!" a post on Musicathon's official Instagram page said. The Instagram post also featured pictures of the performers.

362.title: Satellite pics show 45-foot trench at Ukraine church, site of mass grave
362.article_body: Satellite images show a 45-foot-long trench dug into the grounds of a Ukrainian church where a mass grave was found this week after Russian forces withdrew from the town of Bucha, Maxar Technologies, a private US company said. Ukraine accused Russian forces of carrying out a "massacre" in the town. Russia denied the allegations, calling them a "provocation" by Ukraine.

363.title: Been a lot of healing, coming to normalcy; hoping work will happen soon: Rhea
363.article_body: Actress Rhea Chakraborty said that it has been a lot of healing and coming back to normalcy for her during the COVID-19 lockdown. "So other than that, like work I'm trying, I'm hoping something will happen soon. So fingers crossed," she said. While talking about returning to ramp walking, she said, "I am happy to be back at it."

364.title: Kejriwal’s dreams to progress in other states will be crushed: Union Minister
364.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said AAP's Arvind Kejriwal will be taught such a lesson in Gujarat that his dreams to progress in other states of the country will be "crushed". His remark came after Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann visited Gujarat in the run-up to Assembly polls in the state later this year.

365.title: 11 in-laws of Gujarat nurse booked for torturing her, abetting her suicide
365.article_body: Eleven persons have been booked for allegedly abetting the suicide of a 29-year-old nurse, an employee of Mansa Civil Hospital, in Gujarat's Gandhinagar. Police have recovered a suicide note in which she named 11 of her in-laws, excluding her husband, for allegedly mentally and physically torturing her. The nurse's body was found under mysterious circumstances by some neighbours, police said.

366.title: TN lifts COVID-19 curbs; vaccination no longer compulsory to visit public places
366.article_body: In view of the improving COVID-19 situation, the Tamil Nadu government on Sunday lifted all restrictions in the state and also announced that vaccination against coronavirus is no longer compulsory to visit public places. The state government has advised citizens to continue following COVID-19-appropriate behaviour like maintaining social distance, wearing face masks and washing hands.

367.title: CSK will continue to back Ruturaj Gaikwad: Ravindra Jadeja
367.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja has said they'll continue to back Ruturaj Gaikwad in their upcoming games in the IPL season. "We need to give him confidence...we all know that he's a good player...and I'm sure he'll come good," stated Jadeja. Ruturaj, who had scored 635 runs last season, has scored 0, 1 and 1 so far this season.

368.title: 'Mastermind' behind UP board Class 12 English paper leak arrested
368.article_body: The alleged mastermind behind the UP board Class 12 English paper leak was arrested by Ballia Police on Sunday. Nirbhay Narayan Singh apparently got the paper solved and sold the copies for up to ₹30,000 per student. "It was a difficult case...because the footprint of transactions on social media platforms and digital transactions were difficult to trace," Ballia SP said.

369.title: One arrested for 46-yr-old's murder over drainage dispute in MP
369.article_body: One person has been arrested in connection with the murder of a 46-year-old person over a drainage lane dispute in Madhya Pradesh's Guna. Police said the suspect, identified as 32-year-old Virendra Ahirwar, was detained within two hours after they got information about the murder. The victim was found dead in his house on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday.

370.title: Kartik Aaryan flies to Mauritius for 'Shehzada' shoot
370.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has landed in Mauritius to shoot for his upcoming film 'Shehzada'. He took to his Instagram Stories to share some pictures and videos from Mauritius. The film is the Hindi remake of Allu Arjun-starrer Telugu film 'Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo'. Directed by Rohit Dhawan, 'Shehzada' also stars Kriti Sanon, Manisha Koirala and Paresh Rawal.

371.title: 80 from Haryana complain of diarrhoea, nausea after eating Kuttu flour
371.article_body: 80 people from Haryana's Ambala, Yamunanagar and Karnal districts fell ill after they reportedly consumed food prepared from "kuttu" [buckwheat] flour. At least 49 people from Ambala Cantonment complained of diarrhoea and nausea and were admitted to hospital. Five people from Yamunanagar experienced similar problems. 25 people from Karnal complained of vomiting and loss of consciousness.

372.title: Actress Mohena Kumari Singh shares pictures from her baby shower
372.article_body: Actress-choreographer Mohena Kumari Singh's friends recently threw a 'surprise baby shower' for her. The 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' actress, who's expecting her first child with husband Suyesh Rawat, shared a few pictures from her baby shower on her Instagram handle. "Thankful and grateful for all the love and blessings," Mohena captioned the post.

373.title: Pope pays tribute to journalists killed in war-torn Ukraine
373.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday paid tribute to journalists killed in the war-torn Ukraine since Russia's attack. Talking to journalists, he said, "Your job is a job for the common good. They have fallen in service of the common good of information. Let's not forget that they were courageous. I pray for them, I pray that the Lord rewards their work."

374.title: People of Gujarat are frustrated, waiting for honest party: AAP Gujarat chief
374.article_body: AAP Gujarat President Gopal Italia said that the people of the state are "frustrated" and are waiting for an honest party. With the arrival of both AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, the hopes of the people have increased, Italia added. "BJP government has done nothing in all these years," Italia stated.

375.title: Grammys' 'In Memoriam' section fails to pay tribute to Lata Mangeshkar during ceremony
375.article_body: After the Oscars, the Grammy Awards also omitted late legendary Indian singer Lata Mangeshkar in the 'In Memoriam' section during the ceremony. "So both the Oscars and the Grammys failed to honor the late great Lata Mangeshkar in their respective memoriam segments? That’s a shame," a user tweeted. "Disappointed but not surprised," another user wrote.

376.title: 46 arrested, 7 detained for questioning over stone-pelting incident in Rajasthan
376.article_body: Rajasthan Police has arrested 46 people and detained seven others for interrogation in connection with incidents of stone-pelting and arson during a religious procession in Karauli on Saturday. Police have also seized 21 two-wheeler and four-wheeler vehicles. "The situation is under control but a curfew has been imposed in the city as a precautionary measure," Bharatpur Range IGP said.

377.title: They won't panic: Sam Curran on CSK suffering 3 straight defeats in IPL 2022
377.article_body: Former CSK all-rounder Sam Curran has admitted that it's a tricky situation for CSK after having lost their first three games in a row this IPL season. He, however, also added that the CSK management won't panic. "Having experienced the dressing room there, the coaches, the management, it's a very calm environment there...[they] know how the IPL works," he stated.

378.title: Arooj wins Grammy for her song 'Mohabbat', becomes 1st Pakistani woman to win the award
378.article_body: Vocalist-music composer Arooj Aftab has become the first Pakistani woman to win a Grammy award. Arooj won the 'Best Global Music Performance' award at 2022 Grammys for her song 'Mohabbat'. "I think I am going to faint. Wow...thank you so much. I feel like this category in and of itself has been so insane," she said in her acceptance speech.

379.title: Duped strangers for ₹50 lakh as my aunt had cancer: 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma
379.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma Fallah revealed she duped many strangers while working for a social media app that required her to befriend people and entertain them with her chats. "I duped strangers, [for] about 40-50 lakhs...[but] I wouldn't get...entire amount," she said. "My aunt was diagnosed with cancer. I'd either lie or say the truth and get money," she added.

380.title: Narsinghanand booked for hate speech at 'mahapanchayat' in Delhi
380.article_body: Police have booked religious leader Yati Narsinghanand along with several speakers and organisers over alleged hate speeches at the 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' held in Delhi's Burari on Sunday. Narsinghanand had reportedly urged Hindus to take up arms, claiming that "50% of Hindus will convert" if a Muslim becomes PM. Sudarshan News Chief Editor Suresh Chavhanke was among those who've been booked.

381.title: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam says won't seek second term
381.article_body: Hong Kong's Chief Executive Carrie Lam on Monday said that she would not seek a second term in office in order to focus on family. "There's only one consideration and that is family. I have told everyone before that family is my first priority in terms of my consideration. They think it's time for me to go home," said Lam.

382.title: 3 held for carrying out contract killing of businessman in Delhi
382.article_body: Three men, aged between 22 and 30, were arrested for allegedly murdering a businessman (37) as part of their contract killing in Delhi's Welcome area. The three accused were hired by a duo to take revenge for the latter's brother's death from the victim, police said. The accused were promised ₹3 lakh for carrying out the killing, police said.

383.title: 4 held with illegal weapons in Mohali, links with gangsters being probed
383.article_body: The Kharar Police in Mohali arrested four persons with two unlicensed pistols and live cartridges. The police are investigating the links of the arrested persons with gangsters. The arrests were made on the basis of specific information that some people were entering Kharar with illegal weapons. The police registered a case under relevant sections of the Arms Act.

384.title: Banks force you to travel to the home branch for everything: Jupiter
384.article_body: People face a lot of trouble due to the rules of some banks, said Jupiter, a 100%* digital banking app, adding that people have to take leaves from work or they end up wasting their weekend just doing bank work. Tired of such routines, Jupiter promises to be a banking partner for millennials and offers a 100%* digital banking experience.

385.title: Imran Khan to stay PM till caretaker PM is appointed: Pakistan's President
385.article_body: Imran Khan will remain in office as Pakistan's Prime Minister till a caretaker Prime Minister is appointed, Pakistan's President Arif Alvi clarified in a late-night tweet. This comes after Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) chairman Imran Khan was de-notified as the Prime Minister of Pakistan. Earlier, Deputy Speaker of the National Assembly Qasim Suri dismissed the no-confidence motion against Khan.

386.title: If a Muslim becomes PM, 40% Hindus will be killed: Yati Narsinghanand
386.article_body: The head priest of Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi Temple, Yati Narsinghanand said that once a Muslim becomes the Prime Minister of India, 50 per cent Hindus will convert and 40 per cent will be killed. "Remaining 10 per cent will either live in refugee camps or in other countries in...next 20 years...This will be the future of the Hindus," he added.

387.title: Man tries to enter Gorakhnath Temple in UP raising slogans, injures 2 policemen
387.article_body: A 29-year-old man armed with a sharp-edged weapon on Sunday night allegedly tried to enter the Gorakhnath Temple premises in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur forcefully and injured two policemen deployed there. Police said the man, who also sustained injuries while being overpowered by security personnel, had allegedly raised religious slogans. The motive behind the incident is yet to be ascertained.

388.title: Wave Group flat buyers protest over delay in delivery in Noida
388.article_body: Over 50 homebuyers of Wave Group's Amore apartments in Noida Sector 32 staged a protest over the delay in delivery of flats on Saturday. They raised slogans against the builder's officials. The Wave Group had reportedly promised to deliver flats by 2016. "Out of 780 flats in the project, there are 480 buyers whose investments are stuck," said a protester.

389.title: Kapil celebrates b'day with wife Ginny and daughter Anayra, pics surface
389.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma recently celebrated his 41st birthday with his mother, wife Ginni Chatrath, and daughter Anayra. Several videos and pictures surfaced online from his birthday party. In a video, Kapil was seen dancing as Ginni smiled and clapped her hands. At the event, a neon sign read 'Happy Birthday Kapil' and a two-tier white cake was also seen.

390.title: Heroine worth ₹113 cr found hidden in baggage at Kolkata airport
390.article_body: Three African nationals, including two women, were arrested after nearly 16.15 kg of heroin worth about ₹113 crore was found hidden in their trolley bags at Kolkata International Airport, an official said. The drug haul is believed to be the largest at the airport. The official added that 14 packets of a brown substance were concealed in the bags' cavities.

391.title: Joke writers pray people feel offended as that turns memorable: Varun Dhawan
391.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said that during shows, writers who write jokes always pray that people should feel offended because "that turns into a memorable moment". "It's not so much to the host. We, as hosts, need to check what writers have written before going onto stage," Dhawan added. He also said not having releases in two years makes him anxious.

392.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases drop below 1,000 after 715 days; 13 deaths in 24 hours
392.article_body: India has reported 913 new COVID-19 cases, 1,316 recoveries and 13 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. With this, India's daily COVID-19 cases dropped below 1,000 after 715 days. India's active caseload dropped to 12,597 (less than 13,000 after 714 days), while the death toll reached 5,21,358.

393.title: He needs to find a way to start scoring: Jaffer on Ruturaj scoring 0, 1, 1
393.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer has said CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad "needs to find a way" to start scoring for the franchise in the ongoing IPL season. "Gaikwad does get out nicking. Even in first-class cricket, I have seen him get out behind the wickets," added Jaffer. In CSK's three games so far, Ruturaj has scored 0, 1 and 1.

394.title: Who won what at the 2022 Grammy Awards held today?
394.article_body: Silk Sonic, the group project of Bruno Mars and Anderson .Paak, won the Grammy Award for 'Record of the Year' for 'Leave the Door Open'. Jon Batiste's 'We Are' was named the 'Album of the Year'. Silk Sonic's 'Leave the Door Open' also won the 'Song of the Year' award. US' 19-year-old singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo was named 'Best New Artist'.

395.title: HDFC board approves merger of company with HDFC Bank
395.article_body: The board of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) has approved the merger of the firm with HDFC Bank. Following the merger, HDFC Bank will be 100% owned by public shareholders and existing shareholders of HDFC Limited will own 41% of HDFC Bank. "[It]...shall enable HDFC Bank to build its housing loan portfolio and enhance its existing customer base," HDFC said.

396.title: 28 girl students hospitalised after eating dinner at school hostel in UP
396.article_body: As many as 28 girl students were admitted to a hospital when they complained of uneasiness after having dinner at a residential school run by the Social Welfare Department in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun district. According to officials, the students are stable and would be discharged soon. District Magistrate Deepa Ranjan has formed a committee to investigate the incident.

397.title: Gurugram traffic police launch iRAD app to reduce road accidents
397.article_body: In a bid to reduce road accidents, Gurugram traffic police on Saturday launched an Integrated Road Accident Database (iRAD) that will help monitor and fix engineering defects in roads. The iRAD system comes with a mobile app through which investigation officers can store details of an accident along with pictures and videos using a unique ID.

398.title: Can’t build Amaravati in six months: Andhra Pradesh govt to HC
398.article_body: The YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led government has told the High Court of Andhra Pradesh that it is practically impossible to complete the Amaravati capital city project within six months. This deadline was set by the court in its order a month ago. The state government has sought an extension of the time limit to 60 months.

399.title: Hyd airport's domestic passenger traffic at 109%, crosses pre-COVID level
399.article_body: Officials on Sunday said that the Hyderabad International Airport recorded 109 per cent of pre-COVID daily average domestic passenger traffic on a single day. "[It] is...now connected to over 70 domestic destinations from...pre-Covid period of 55 domestic destinations," an official release said. During the first half of March 2022, airport witnessed about seven lakh domestic passengers.

400.title: Drugs worth ₹3 crore seized in Assam’s Morigaon, 3 held
400.article_body: Police seized drugs worth around ₹3 crore on Sunday in Assam’s Morigaon district and apprehended three persons. Based on a tip-off, the police team of Morigaon district conducted checking at the Jagiroad Silbhanga area and intercepted a motorcycle. During the checking, the police team recovered 309 grams of drugs, Moon Prakash Tiwari, Officer-in-Charge of Jagiroad Police Station, said.

401.title: 6 killed, 12 injured in mass shooting in California
401.article_body: Multiple shooters opened fire at about 2 am on Sunday in California's state capital of Sacramento, killing six people and wounding 12 others, police said. Three men and three women were killed and at least four of the wounded were hospitalised with life-threatening injuries, police added. Authorities have not identified any of the victims or offered a possible motive.

402.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to seize vehicles of motorists driving on wrong side of road
402.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has decided to start seizing the vehicles of motorists who are found driving on the wrong side of the road, after 2,649 FIRs were filed for the offence between March 6 and 31. "It is observed that even after 25 days of launching an awareness campaign, people have not learnt a lesson," a senior police officer said.

403.title: 2 detained for threatening locals after videos went viral in Pune
403.article_body: The police have detained two men for allegedly threatening local residents in Pune after videos showing them wield sharp weapons and create law and order situations went viral. The police said that over a dozen such videos have been shared by the residents. "We are verifying these videos and a process of identifying the men is going on," said police.

404.title: Several areas of Chennai to face power cut today from 9 am to 2 pm
404.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (TANGEDCO) has announced that parts of Chennai will have a disruption to electrical power supply on Monday from 9 am to 2 pm. The supply will be cut in order to carry out maintenance work in the city. The affected areas will be Porur-Thirumudivakkam, Tidel Park/Ezhil Nagar, Avadi, Guindy, Tambaram and Sembium.

405.title: Man demands change in Hyd airport washroom signboard, authorities respond
405.article_body: A Twitter user said that the washroom signboard at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad that currently reads "Female" should be renamed to "Ladies". He said writing "Female" is "a bit crude and impolite". The airport authorities replied to his tweet saying that his suggestion has been noted and has been sent for consideration.

406.title: Found self-confidence in my 30s; didn't think about what others would say: Kim
406.article_body: Kim Kardashian, who recently appeared on the cover of Vogue Hong Kong, spoke about the lessons she learnt ever since she rose to fame. Kim said that she is now eating well, working out and having more fun with her family. She added that in her 30s she found self-confidence. "[I cared] less about what everyone else thought," Kim said.
